review_content: I ordered the five-pack and I received generic Made in China filters and not Brita brand filters.  This is despite the product description calling them Brita filters and the pictures of the product having the Brita logo.

I've read all the answers from Brita to the comments posted by unsatisfied customers about the filter NOT staying sealed tightly. I know about first rinsing a new filter in cold water for 15 seconds. I know that you need to line up the filter with the grooves. I know you then push down hard the filter so it locks in place - so called! AFTER HAVING DONE THIS, the filter still pops up a fraction causing water to leak through the sides of said filter. Now, I am 6'5", 250 lbs. I lift weights 4 days a week. I am not a weak duckling. Yet, time after time, even after pushing down the filter with all my strength, the filter will not stay tightly secured in place. Why there is no rubber ring for added sealment remains a mystery to me. Why they didn't design this to "screw" said filter in place so it is water tight (versus just dropping the filter into the pitcher and pushing down), is a mystery to me. And, even when the filter does happen to seal a little tighter than it normally does, as soon as I move the pitcher about (to pour water for example), the filter will pop up again. The design is flawed, plain and simple. I do not have a bad device per say, it's just that they did not design the filter housing with effectiveness.
NA

Fantastic water filter, and when Brita says "advanced" they aren't blowing smoke.I was disenchanted with Brita back in the day - the filters seemed awfully fussy to set up, and they seemed to need changing quite often.  So far I haven't had any issues with these new filters.  Priming it took 15 seconds - no joke - and it was pretty much ready right after priming.  That's to say, I didn't get any black dust or floaties in the first few loads, like I did with the older filters.So I'm back to Brita.  This is a good filter and it does a good job.

I used these replacement filters for my Brita grand pitcher and they work great. I have very hard water in the area where I live and this filter really helps a lot. Also, I noticed I would get the change light super early. They last a lot longer than the pitcher claims.Pros:*Easy to install.*Works well.*Water doesn't take long to go through the filter.Cons:*NoneAdditional Considerations:Make sure the right filters are bought to fit the size of your pitcher.Overall: 5/5 stars (>=.5 rounds up, <.5 rounds down) => 5 starsIf you have any further questions regarding the product in my review please leave a comment below and I will get back to you as soon as possible.

These are a newer design than the filters I have previously purchased. The new shape makes them easier to grasp and install. You also no longer need to soak the filters prior to use, which I find more convenient. The newer design seems to filter the water much quicker which is great for my family that can go through a pitcher very rapidly. I have also noticed that there aren't any of those unsightly black "floaters" in my water anymore.As for the functionality, these filters make my tap water taste much better and remove many of the impurities and toxins. Given the amount of water you can filter, this is not only a much more cost effective solution to bottled water but also more environmentally friendly one.Overall, these are great filters at a reasonable price! I will be purchasing more in the near future.

I love these filters. I drink over a gallon a day and buying water bottles was getting a bit expensive and annoying (having to buy 2 cases a week and then running out without knowing). These are the 2nd set I buy. The first set of 3 lasted me about 4 months. So I would say a month per filter which in my case is great considering I was spending over $20 in water bottles each month. It is very convenient and inexpensive. And I can have cold water everyday without having to remember to put more water bottles in the fridge after I take one.

These Brita filters are an improvement over the old Brita filters. We've used Brita filters for years and I didn't notice when I ordered these that the design has changed a bit. The taste of our water after using these filters is the same as we are used to (the filters remove that chlorine taste that our regular tap water has), but the water filters through quicker, which is nice. I've also noticed there is virtually no black carbon specs slipping into the water pitcher like we had with the old Brita filters. I wasn't looking for a different Brita filter but I'm glad I ordered these and I'll make sure I will get the same kind again the next time I need to reorder.

I have a plain old brita pitcher. Bullet items say this product is NOT for the brita "stream" model. The instructions in the package refer to the electronic light. The instructions say light will change 3 times if you place label correctly. My pitcher does not have a light. Upon checking brita site I discovered the instructions are for the brita "stream."  Also bullet item says no rinsing necessary. Yet instructions say to rinse. I'm just not sure I got what I thought I was buying and if anyone cares?

When I bought this pitcher I thought the lid would cover the entire pitcher just like it shows on the package. It turns out there is no lid for the pouring part which made me very disappointed about this product because I wanted to use this for a small fridge.
NA

I use these with my Brita pitcher. As a college student, this is a lifesaver for being able to get clean water in a dorm room without wasting hundreds of plastic bottles a month.  The button on the top of the filter allows for easy installation and replacement. Brita guarantees that Brita brand filters will work in any of their products, and in my experience, this has been the case. The filter uses activated carbon to filter the water.I purchased a three pack for $12 with Prime shipping versus my local store price of $25 dollars for three. They arrived individually wrapped and unharmed in a box. When opened, the filters can be moist because packaged in a way so that they are ready for immediate use.Note: on the instructions that the first one or two pitchers of water should be used to water plants or similar to allow the filter to begin functioning properly. I drank the first few pitchers despite this warning, and the water tasted fine without any carbon residue.

If you have problems with water in your area and you want to make it better for you kitchen needs this filter water replacements are absolutely great for most of the contaminants in your plumbs. In particular I have to say that without using that filter I always had a precipitate on the bottom and walls of my pan. Now, I do not worry about that et all, using this filters I can cook without bothering to buy spring water or any bottled water from a grocery store.For those who have kids it is absolutely essential to have one of those if you do not have pure water in your area.

Brita filters a great. they work well and last, I have been using Brita for many many years and will continue to do so .  Pre-soaking is no longer required, and a new mesh is meant to prevent carbon flecks from leaking into the water. The flecks were always harmless, but unsightly. That new top is also a lot easier to grab-This filter still does what Brita has always done. Remove chlorine, sediment, zinc to make your water taste better, and reduce various other metallic/toxic contaminants that may be present. It makes tap water taste better, potentially makes the water safer, and costs far less than bottled water. Besides that, filtering is much more environmentally-friendly than bottled water  so your are helping the environment and saving money

We live in Arizona, where the water is awful.  It's hard, and full of minerals and salts from the desert.  We drink only bottled water, but use filtered water to make coffee and tea. We've had a Brita pitcher for several years, and liked it for this purpose. When it was time to change the filter, it was inconvenient to let the filter soak for 15 minutes before putting it in the pitcher. These new filters only need to be rinsed thoroughly under the faucet before use.  The old filters also seemed to leave more charcoal powder in the pitcher than these new ones do.

I was very unhappy when the package arrived because these filters didn't look like the ones I'd been using for years, nor did they look like the ones pictured.  But when I went to use them, I was delighted!  Formerly the water trickled so slowly into the pitcher and you had to wait around to put more in.  With these filters, the water fills up the pitcher SO much more quickly.  One hopes the quality of the water that has gone through the filter is just as good...

I started using the Brita water Pitcher over 5 years ago. I always complained about how hard it was to remove the filter from the pitcher, until now.Thank jesus for R&D. Now they made so it's very easy to get out and you do not have to soak it in a glass of water anymore.These filter works great and you can really tell the difference when drinking water. No chlorine taste and no charcoal flakes floating around in the water.Good price great product.I only gave it 4 stars because 5 stars are meant for angels and gods.

Great replacements to use in my counter top container, these work great and are easy to use / replace. They are good for 2 months so this 3 pack is a great buy for me.I am a firm believer that water has a taste, I know it's the stuff in the water that makes it taste different. I love these filters as we have well water that sometimes has some dirt and sediments and these filters clean all of that out so we have great tasting water every time.We go through a lot of drinking water and these filters last the whole 2 months, probably could last longer but we go ahead and change them as recommended.  If this review is helpful to you, please push the button below. Thanks and God bless!

Absolute waste of money. I have been using my Brita water filter for 10 years and never had a problem with it until I started using these replacement filters. These float out even after being pressed in. I fill the upper reservoir and I see the filter unseat. At other times I am tipping the pitcher to use the filtered water and I hear a "clunk" and I know the filter has fallen out.Brita has changed their replacement filter design and it's a few fractions of a millimeter too small, making for a loose fit.

I bought the 3-pack filters elsewhere. However, I found that the new filter style leaked some water down the side of the filter after the install, instead of going through the inside element. After looking at it, I pushed down harder on the replacement filter to seat it correctly. The upper lip of the replacement filter is now just below the lower lip of the housing. That fixed the problem. Now all water exits through the four holes in the filter bottom. The older filters did not require as much elbow grease. Hope this helps those complaining about leaking filters or tap-tasting filtered water. We've enjoyed our Brita for years and I hope it continues to last.

I'm happy with these Brita water filters. They fit my Brita pitcher and the water tastes very clean. The water doesn't take too long to filter through it. I have discovered that I need to leave the pitcher in the sink after filling, without carrying it to the fridge until all of the water has filtered through. Otherwise, carrying the pitcher while it filters occasionally causes the filter to dislodge a little, allowing unfiltered water to pass through very quickly. It would be nice if there was a way to lock it in place. Otherwise, I'm very happy.

Generally a good filter, but they do not seem to fit Brita pitchers as well as the generics. I bought the counter-top dispenser and both the filter that came with it and the first from my replacement order "pop out" of their mounts every few days. When that happens, unfiltered water flows straight through into the dispenser, requiring me to dump the (now contaminated) water in the dispenser, disassemble the dispenser, reseat the filter, and refill.Generic filters have a much tighter fit in the dispenser; I have to pull harder to get them out, but they STAY IN.
NA

Needed some filter replacements for our Brita pitchers.  We have 3 in our kitchen so this pack of three was perfect.  I could have easily purchased the same pack at the store for a similar price but the convenience of having these delivered to your day in a few days, with Prime, is what got me.  These are the same filters you would buy at any store and packaged the same way.  At the time I purchased these filters, they were actually cheaper than it was at my local stores so that was a big plus at the time.  Would recommend this to anyone that uses their Brita a lot and needs a more convenient way of getting these filters.

These things may look a bit different from the filter which is included with the purchase of a pitcher, but they will install just as easily and work as effectively. Still recommended to dump your first three pitchers due to carbon dust, though, but given how long these things last, it's hardly an issue. No black flecks in the filtration section due to the improved design, which is nice.Cleanses your water so you won't have to deal with the garbage-taste from the tap. I've only went through one filter as of yet; the average lifetime of the last filter was a little more than two months (for a household of three). I purchased the 3-pack, expecting it to last through half of a year.I highly recommend Brita for your water filtration needs. Easy to install, tastes great, and helps to save the environment one bottle at a time.

These new-style filters are no good.  Sure, they don't require soaking, and the black specks aren't an issue any longer, but these filters are not filtering chlorine like the old style did.  The old ones would yield water I could never smell chlorine in, and the new ones leave a noticeable chlorine smell.  Tried 4 different filters out of the two different multipacks thinking the first was a manufacturing issue, same results each time.It is time to switch brands or finally do a whole-home filter.  Such a shame, Brita had an ardent promoter in me.

I'm basically reviewing the Brita system.  I've tried several of the off brand filters to try and save some money, but the only filters that I have come across that reduce TDS are the Brita brand.  Of course, there is Zero Water which is not an economical solution IMO and also reportedly has reported issues with turning the water acidic before the filter is "spent" and is still removing solids.  At any rate, there must be a DI resin in the Brita filters that the generics that I have tried do not have.  And this is the thing that I think is unrealized ... the Brita system does reduce total dissolved solids.  It is not just a particulate and carbon "taste" filter.  TDS out of our tap is around 150.  First pass from a new Brita cuts it in half.  Second pass cuts it by about 60% more.  I mix Brita filtered water, half and half, with distilled and need to get the Brita filtered water TDS down into the 30's so that, when mixed with distilled water (0 TDS), the mix is below 20 TDS.  I drink almost nothing but water and my water has to have virtually no taste at all.  Below 20 TDS, the water is taste free to my palate.  My wife drinks water with a little of the flavor that comes in the small squeeze bottles, and she drinks tea.  One pass through the Brita is fine with her.  Between the two of us, we get about 10-14 days from a Brita filter.  No where near 200 gallons, or whatever Brita claims.  But again, I have some strange requirements.  At any rate, 10-14 days is about the time where it takes 4 passes through the filter to be able to get the TDS down low enough for my palate (20 TDS or less, mixed with 1/2 distilled) and it becomes too much of a chore.  Probably not a bad thing to change the filter more often as the pitcher gets cleaned frequently.  The bottom line is that we really aren't saving much money using the Brita system over buying bottled water.  Maybe a few bucks because we don't need to buy spring water for my wife so it's convenient to only have to lug 3 gallon bottles of distilled from the grocery store each week for my finicky palate and no spring water since my wife is good with the Brita.  We haven't tried the PUR or any other system.  And we wont try the Zero Water because of the reported issues with low PH acidic water (sour) and the cost of the filters.  All in all, the Brita system works pretty well for us and the filters don't cost an arm and a leg.  We've been using the Brita for 3 or 4 years now.  There are often good deals here on Amazon for 5 or 6 packs of the filters too.  Not perfect, but a pretty good system for us.

Horrible taste. These Filters could not possibly be real Brita filters. I have bought Brita filters before and I was satisfied with the water that went through the filters but these were so horrible that it is hard to describe! The water tasted putrid. No one would drink the water at our house that came out of these filters. It was that bad. These are fake Brita filters. I had to go to Walmart and buy genuine Brita filters.

I bought my BRITA pitcher (5 CUP SLIM PITCHER) a few months ago just to test it and i absolutely love it! I use to buy bottled water however when i moved to a building with stairs it got very inconvenient to carry bottles of water. its been 2 months now and its time to replace the filter which is why i purchased this product. For a little over 13 dollars you get 3 filters which is equivalent to 6 months of clean tasty water without any hassle. Most people drink straight from the tap but with Brita, you can feel 100 times safer knowing this product removes harmful chemicals such as  Mercury copper and cadmium.
NA

Nice to get these filters at a better price than the stores. They fit the Brita Pitcher perfectly and filter the water quickly. Glad I purchased them as they arrived prior to the hurricane and allowed me to filter and store about 10 gallons of water. This was a great safety net to have along with the bottled water we had on hand. We also use the filtered water for coffee in the morning and it makes it taste much better than unfiltered water.

After seeing that over 1600 people gave this 5 stars, I have come to the conclusion that over 1600 have never tasted good water! Why does my water taste worse than tap after I filter it?  If the water sits in the pitcher overnight it tastes and smells like chlorine. I reassure you that it was not just one filter but over 5 of them have done this.  I live in NYC so there is no question about quality, we have the best tasting water in the country.  So why does the Brita filter make it taste so horrible?  I was using the Culligan filters previously but decided to switch to this because the Brita filters the water quicker.  I think I am going to switch back to Culligan and deal with the long filtration process because I need water that tastes like water not bleach.
NA

Brita filters are amazing. I am in college so I don't have easy access to good tasting, filtered water in my room. Using my Brita pitcher and these filters makes it easy to fill up the pitcher with tap water and get clean great tasting water. I have tried to use generic brand filters before, but they really do not compare to these Brita filters. The taste is amazing and they last a long time before needing to be replaced. I also really like how the pitcher has a notification system to let you know when to swap a new filter. The price on Amazon is also a great deal.I highly recommend these filters for anyone who uses a water pitcher filtration system.

I had the Brita UltraMax water filter dispenser system and had to purchase the Brita Water filter refils. However I bought the 3 pack one and totally forgot about it and found out about it a year later when cleaning out our kitchen cabinet.  However, the inside filter is not filtering and when shaking it around you don't hear the typical sandy sound, but more like harden clunks.  I did not know that these types of refils would go back after a while. They are not cheap either, but I guess for better water quality for me and my family I will have to get replacement.

I live in an area where the tap water has a more chlorinated taste, which could trace to the fact that I live within a mile of the city water treatment plant.  So I bought a Brita Water Filter Pitcher, and found these replacement filters on Amazon, fit & work great!  Really removes the chlorine taste from local water,and I find the filters last about 3-months before needing replacement.  Very satisfied!

This is a simple replacement for the filters used on the pitcher.Not a lot to say about it other than it works as good as the original.- I used these filters to filter out grit from my well water (no city water), really does get all of that out, and water does taste better in general - tastes pretty similar (after filtering) to bottled water!- Rated as good for 40 gallons, but you can use it for longer,  depending on use, you'll get a few months out of oneServes its purpose just fine, I can't think of any particular cons at this time.

Our tap water is pretty disgusting with tons of chlorine.  We rely on a counter top brita filter for all of our water, including our pets'.  The brita makes our water taste good and have no chlorine smell.  We use it so much that we have to replace the filter monthly, but with the inexpensive Amazon price it is still WAY more affordable than buying bottled water.  Also, bottled water is terrible for the environment so isn't an option.  Love these filters!

These water filters fit in a Brita pitcher.  I like the filtered water, as it doesn't taste like chlorine.  However, it does not remove lead or other impurities that can cause health problems.  We also use the filtered water in the coffee pot as recommended by the manufacturer.  The filters have to be replaced periodically, so I schedule that in my iPhone calendar so that I won't forget.

The problem is that water smells strong chemical after filtering, you do not want to drink it even. I even called my local water company to checkout if it is local water problem, but it is not. In my case I filtered twice, because it still tastes a bit of sandy after filtering 2 times. I called Brita, they sent me new one, but it is same thing. A little less chemical smells, but kind of sandy even after filtering water twice.

Living in Jacksonville, FL where the tap water is very hard and can sometimes smell of dissolved solids, the Brita filter eliminates most of the unpleasantness and does so for at least 8 weeks of normal use. I use my Brita pitcher to filter water that I use in our office Keurig coffee machine and as I go through a lot of coffee in the course of a week, my Brita pitcher and filter go through a lot of nasty tap water. The product could be improved if it fit the housing a bit tighter; in every fill you can see that some of the water from the reservoir enters the pitcher by channeling around the filter element so ultimately some of the water in the Brita pitcher is actually "unfiltered." Aside from the loose tolerances in fit, these filters do the job.

I use these in a two gallon Brita water tank. The improved taste of the tap water is significant, making it very worthwhile to use this method of filtering. The filters come in a package of three and they last for about three months each, or a total (higher math) nine months. Filter replacement is very intuitive leaving the next replacement date the only thing to remember to insure good tasting water from your tank or pitcher. Whether this item is something you should consider depends on how satisfied you are with the way your water tastes coming out of the tap. Some locations are better than others. Also, if you have a water dispenser on your refrigerator, this is not for you, unless the filters fit in that system.

I love the brita water filter pitcher, but unfortunately for this particular refill I would rather just have the regular filter. It doesn't seem to stay down and the water runs through it very fast. Of course it is nice not to have to wait a long time for it to filter, but if it just runs through it doesn't seem like anything is being filtered. I'll go back to the regular filters.

It's nice to know my family is exposed to less lead, because hope do you know?  I like not having to rinse so much before use (read instructions).  They are smaller than the type that came with my older pitchers so I tend to over-fill, leaving too much in the reservoir & when I pour water comes out to fast.  I like that fact that these last twice as long as the other filters too.

New filter design but fits even older style Brita pitchers.  I really can't tell a huge difference between the old and new, but it seems these are slightly better and keeping the charcoal bits from getting into the water.  Frankly that never bothered me much, because in Japan we would put who pieces of charcoal into our pitchers to make better tasting water so getting charcoal bits was totally normal for me (and let me know the water had been treated too!)A tip: These filters are sold in a variety of pack sizes, but the largest isn't necessarily the best deal.  Make sure you check beforehand which is the best deal.  When I purchased, the 3 pack was cheapest per unit.5 stars.  No need for bottled water here!

Because in America, we drink our water straight from a $40 filtered pitcher kept in our $2500 stainless fridge!  Seriously... bought these, they're fine, and it's one less thing to worry about on my to-do list.  Until I run out, at which time I'll buy these exact same filters.  Or until I grow tired of my kids not refilling the pitcher and putting it back in the fridge and chuck it and go back to using the sink faucet.  At which time I'll probably have at least two of these left and I'll probably keep them around for years because they're perfectly good, so why throw them away?  But I'd still give them five stars because it's not their fault my kids are lazy.
So much better than replacing the standard filters so often - this is much better!

I live in Portland, Oregon, which has the best municipal drinking water quality in the United States. But I work in a building that is nearly 100 years old, with old pipes (which run along a Superfund toxic clean-up site). I have used Brita filters for twenty years, and I cannot tell the difference between this and the bottled water which has recently been delivered to my location.I drink a LOT of water (about a gallon per day). I love water with a little crystalized lemon or lime added. I have indulged this passion for more than two decades using these filters with no cause for regret.

I would give this product 5 stars except for the fact it's not the best way to filter water to eliminate all toxins. It certainly does clean a bit and makes the water taste much better, but it doesn't filter Floruide and others. For this I recommend getting a distiller which can be found on amazon for about $80. Just remember distilling also removes the good stuff, so you'd need to add your own minerals into that water (like electrolyte drops containing high concentrate of Magnesium, potassium, calcium, etc)It also does get expensive after time.

I know our water is terrible tasty where I live in Louisiana.  It even makes the coffee taste bad.  My son gave me the Brita Advanced Water Filter Pitcher for Christmas and I love it.  I don't know if it is because the water is full of contaminants but I do find I have to change the filter often.  I even fill my dogs water bowl with the filtered water.  I like buying the replacement filters from Amazon.  I find the price is reasonable and love that it comes to my front door and don't have to drive 11 miles to purchase.

Love the Brita, my only complaint would be the excess charcoal that is in the water reservoir and stays in there even after soaking the filter, rinsing it off and then running three pitchers of water thru it before actually using it. I've noticed that not all the filters do it, this is my second Brita and my first lasted a couple years. I go thru a ton of water, literally 2 to 3 a day with coffee,cooking, and drinking. With that said, about 4 out of 10 have that excess charcoal in the water. It doesn't drain into the pitcher, but it is annoying.

After reading the other reviews, I decided to write this because I experienced none of the problems they reported. I followed the directions on the package filling up and filtering the water 2 times and the filtered water was crystal clear. I love my Brita water filter because in my area the water has a strong chlorine odor. Highly recommended great money saver compared to other sellers.

Typical standard Brita replacement filters. These generally will last about 4-6 weeks given the hard water that comes out of the faucet. I use the Brita pitcher water to wash fruits and vegetables . For drinking purposes I prefer the Zero water pitcher and it's filters as they filter the water till it's at least identical to bottled drinking water standards which is higher than what the Brita filters can do.Brita pitchers are better made than the Zero water pitchers which are made with a thinner plastic so they crack easily. After using my full size Zero water pitcher once, it split so I took it back to Walmart where I had bought it, and exchanged it for the smaller pitcher which was a slightly thicker gauged plastic. Amazon has very competitive prices for the Zero water filters!

I have used Brita for quite some time and plan on continuing to.  I actually use them through two "timer countdowns" and have been satisfied for the most part.  Once in awhile a small amount of the filter material gets into the water but apparently they have a newly designed filter now to stop that.  Also occasionally the filter material seems to become compacted and thus slow down the filtration flow considerably.  Taking the filter out and tapping in upside down in the sink or on the counter loosens it pretty good to get the flow back to more normal.  This does not seem to affect the quality of the filtered water.

First let me say that I have used Brita for at least 15 years. I have never had a problem with them. Now Im writing my first bad review. both of the blue filters that are supposed to last 3 times as long as the org. have clogged up after 2 weeks of use. I thought that maybe I just got a bad one so I tried the 2nd one and it clogged also..so no more blues for me.

I bought a Brita Water Filter Pitcher a few months ago. We have very hard water in our area, so I used the supplied two filters quickly (each one lasted about 2 months and I filter about 1 1/2 gallons of water a day).  I bought this pack of 6 and the only minus I would give the purchase is that there are no detailed instructions in this packet and the details are important in using the filter correctly.  I had to access the directions for filter use via the Internet. So if you still have your original directions from the pitcher, KEEP THEM. It takes some time for the water to drip through the filter, so do something else while this is happening or you will find yourself taping the counter waiting for the water to completely go through. My water tastes so much better, no Cl smell or taste at all. Overall I like the product.

These new redesigned filters have not worked very well for me. They form a very poor seal in their hole, causing water to leak past the filter constantly. They also like to fall out while I'm pouring, which is quite annoying. It is nice not having to pre-soak them like the old ones, or having tons of charcoal dots floating around in the pre-filter reservoir, but I would much rather they actually worked. I mean really, how much would it cost them to put a small rubber gasket around the rim of the filter. Boom, problem solved. I was able to fix the problem in my case by putting tape around the edge of the hole, so clearly some kind of gasket would work perfectly.All of that aside, they do filter pretty well. If you can get it to stay in, and form a good seal, the water is excellent. The water in my city has a very high chlorine content, and these filter completely remove that taste.Update: after fighting with this stupid thing for 20 minutes, I decided to reduce my review from 2/5 to 1/5. This thing won't make a seal no matter what I try, and I end up with a 50/50 mix of filtered and unfiltered water in the pitcher. They really screwed up with this thing.

I have tried many Brita style water filter replacement cartridges and usually purchased based on price was the factor.Turns out most compatibles are a waste of money and time waiting for the water to filter with questionable results as well.These genuine Brita filters work consistently well and are the only way to go, others may be cheaper but they simply are not worth it.

I do not buy bottled water!  I drink tap water---sometimes funny tasting tap water---hold yer noseSulfur water that I'm told is good for me.  Um.  But!  Two years ago I was gifted with a BritaPitcher.  It really makes a difference.  I soon needed replacement filters because I followedmanufacturer's instructions.  DON'T FOLLOW MANUFACTURE'S INSTRUCTIONS!  I'vefound that I can use Brita filters for many months and the water quality is crystal clear andwithout any unpleasant taste.  I only replace filters when the filter gets clogged up.

I agree with W. Kordnason (October 4, 2017):  We use a Brita Ultramax tank and like the results.  We tried these new filters, hoping to change less often.  But after 3 months the filtration is so slow that we are changing.  Here in the Pacific Northwest, filtration isn't really an issue, but we like to be extra-careful.  I'm switching  back to the standard filters.  BTW, we have not experienced any leaking or bad-fitting of the filter in the tank, as some reviews have reported.

We were very disappointed in these filters.  We purchased the Britta Ultra Max on Amazon which came with one filter.  It worked great!  Water tasted great.  Then we ordered this 3 pack of filters but the water has tasted like dirt ever since.Update:  We have used all three filters in the box, all with the same outcome, horrible tasting water.  We did keep the original filter.  After comparing the original filter to the replacements there is a BIG difference in the amount of filter material in the cartridge.  Big difference!  The repalcements are only half full, if that.  The charcoal or whatever is in the filters is different from the original to the replacement filters.  DO NOT BUY THESE!  They do not work!

I think they meant new and improved for Brita, not for the customer. Water seems to move through these more quickly than the old style. Yes, its been inserted correctly. Even after a week of use, water still moves through the filter noticeably quicker than the old style. I image the less time the water spends in the filter, the less its cleaned. Does Brita put less carbon in these than the old style? I've used Brita filters for years, these filters do not clean the water as well as the old ones. I can taste the difference. I have not noticed any specs of carbon in the reservoir though, that is an improvement. I cannot recommend this.
NA

Love, love LOVE the new Brita Filters! No more Soaking, waiting, forgetting that you're soaking and waiting, then going back out to the kitchen to drain the thing and running a couple of pitchersful of water through. This is INSTANT (well...pretty much) gratification, and tasty at that!  Everything you always could want or expect from Brita - which should by now be in EVERY household in the world, in my opinion - quality, cost-effectiveness, and now...NO BLACK STUFF. And fast switching of filters! I'm in heaven! BRITA USER FOREVER!!!! (I still have my Brita Pitcher that I bought 24 years ago!)

These are bad. Brita didn't even bother to put in the effort to make sure they fit properly. I placed one in my pitcher and there were clearly visible gaps in a few places. Once I filled the top reservoir, I could see water streaming from the 4 filter outlets as well as from around the edges of it. The only way to prevent it was holding the filter down with a fair amount of pressure. Obviously not something you want to be doing during every filtration. This definitely didn't happen with the included filter, which seems pretty shady. I saw it mentioned in some other reviews, but I had hoped that was just a bad batch. I'd guess MAYBE half of the water going into my pitcher is being filtered.

exactly what i needed.. I was amazed how crystal clear the water was after everything was setup, especially since the water used to soak the filter was so grey colored. I have found zero black carbon particles in the water since i've filled it up (i've filled it about 4-5 times now). The lid for the filter makes a tight seal when put on properly, I was very happy to find after filling it once i could fill the filter again so when i use up the filtered water it filters more of the unfiltered water (wow sorry if that's a bit confusing)

Have used this product for years.  We used to have a well and the Brita cleaned the water.  We had it tested every two years.  We now live in an area where the water, while it passes all tests for potability, it has a very high amount of lime.  Enough, that when you boil the water there is always an accumulation of white calcium (lime) it the bottom of the container.  Using the Brita removes enough lime that there is no accumulation in the container.

Remember: predators conceal themselves in murky waters. To counter their evil cunning--their blood-thirsty gaze--I bought a fancy pitcher with an electronic function that reminds me to swap out me outdated filters. These are the replacement filters and, unless the whole world is being duped by Brita and its water-purifying minions, I assume they are doing their job and keeping my drinking water free of parasites hungry for human brain matter.

I was hesitant to buy these filters due to all the negative reviews about not fitting in the Brita pitcher (and subsequent, obnoxious canned response from the company about making sure they were inserted correctly- surely everyone couldn't be incompetent) but figured that if they didn't fit I would just send them back. I had absolutely no problem with the filters- well, one did leak a bit of carbon after I conditioned it but it cleared up with a  rinse.These filters seem comparable to the Brita filters.
Filter does not fit tightly into the filter opening of pitcher.

works, I to like the new design of the top part easier to pull, instead of having to tap it upside down (the current pitcher - Brita Grand Water Filter Pitcher- keeps it very tight which I like, seems to be a gamble )still costly for what it ison a side note:WHY can't Brita create a pitcher that allows you to add more water, and pour whatever is already filtered right away even if water is being filtered. seems like an easy problem to solve, like an easy 1/4 screw top or whatever.seems like they don't put much effort in R&D

Where I live there is a lot of carbon in the water (showing up as black specs) and these filters remove it. I've bought these time and time again to use in my Brita Water Filter. Fresh and clear water is the result. These are very easy to replace. You just soak it in a glass of water for 15 minutes and then insert it in any Brita Water Filter pitcher. Love!

They seems to be a bit more snug than I remember, I've been using off brand filters for a bit because I got a seemingly never ending economy sized package of them at a big box store ages ago that recently ran out. These do their job but it takes me about 30 seconds on average to jam it in which is frustrating, but at least it's only a once in a while thing.

I bought this to use as a replacement for my Brita pitcher.  The problem is that it does not seal tight and the water just leaks out through the bottom, around the 4 little plug things.  You have to push down on the filter constantly while water is in the top part of the filter to keep it from leaking out of the bottom. I do not plan on buying this again.

Excellent product -- Functions as intended --The MUCH "improved" design of the of the top of the filter makes "seating" the filter soooo much easier -- Before, w/ the OLD style, you could never really keep the filter seated, and many times [more often than not] I would end up CRUSHING the top portion of the filter, just trying in vain to get the darn thing seated, and even then it was a crap-shoot -- THANK YOU, BRITA !!!! Love the new "plunger" style top of the filter, seats w/ great ease

When you think of water pitchers, you might assume they get you for the high cost of the replacement filters. This isn't the case with these Brita filters. Given that they are less than $5 each in this bundle, you really can't go wrong. Especially since they only need to be replaced every 2 months. That's less than $2.50 a month for clean water which is amazing. I'm really happy with these filters and they have produced some pretty great tasting water so far. I highly recommend these.

I realize there are pros and cons to this type of product, and people have strong feelings one way or the other.  We could not afford a real "water system."  We started using these about six years ago after I had my first (and only, thank God) kidney stone).  Someone told me we should filter our water.  I was skeptical, but we chose Brita.  Almost immediately my husband noticed that his chronic stomach/system problems went away.  He keeps his own pitcher in his office, and unlike me, does not change the filters like clockwork every two months.  However, his body tells him when he is overdue to change the filter (no, I am not making this up :-).  It seems to take some of the bad stuff out of our "city water", and that is a good thing.

These filters are really quite an improvement over the older ones.  They do not need to be soaked before use, which I always found a pain.  I use filtered water for drinking, and also for making things like coffee or tea, as I live in a city where the water is heavily chlorinated and fluoridated, and though I have lived here since 1962, I have never been able to stand the smell of the tap water, especially for brewing hot drinks.  The filters take out the offending chemicals, and I am happy they are now more convenient to use.
Fits in standard pitchers, just has a new design.  No soaking needed, which is a plus.

Our Brita pitcher came with a different style of filter that was not only incredibly difficult to get out, but seemed to give up the ghost after about a week. So I bought these replacements and what a difference! Although I think it's nearing the end, the one we have now has lasted us about three months and done a great job the whole time. It's also about a thousand times easier to put in or take out for cleaning or replacement with this new design. At five bucks a piece for the three pack, these have long since paid for themselves and we're only on the first one! Definitely recommend these for any Brita pitcher (which I also highly recommend).

These Brita filters are amazing. They work extremely well and I feel like they last incredibly long, so really the 3 pack is just in case you happen to filter a lot of water and you need a back up. This is something I always like to keep on hand and I would recommend that other Brita users do so as well. They only take 15-20 seconds to rinse off and insert into your pitcher! I have to say this price is a lot better than I have seen in store too.

These filters are great for filtering out the bad taste of city water. I use them in a small pitcher. The filters last about 6 months for me and I fill up the pitcher 2-6 times a day. I can't recommend the these filters enough. I wish I could have all of my water run through one of these filters. However, I live in an apartment and can't install a full filtration system. Having this is great.

Not having to soak Brita filters in a container of water for 20 minutes is a game changer.  I now just run it under the faucet for 20 seconds, pop it in the pitcher and i'm done.UPDATE 6/17/16I've also noticed very little if any charcoal particles in the water immediately after installing a new filter, which is a big change from the old filters.

I was really excited when I received my new Brita water filter pitcher . . . until I tried to put it together.  The instructions are not very user friendly and before I finally figured out the proper assembly, I was afraid I'd break the thing!  It's working fine now, though.  I really have a hard time with the impurities in water and live in an area with very hard water.  Drinking filtered water is a big improvement.  Thank you, Brita, for a nice product.  Please revise your assembly insert.

I only came back to brita water filters because Walmart stopped selling their generic version of their filter!!!I live at the beach and the water here is very hard....  and it is noticeable when you put the water in ice trays and freeze them. The brita takes away the taste and makes ice taste normal BUT this doesn't do as good as job as the generic brand I used to buy from Walmart... (which is no longer made.. and they only sell Brita brand now...)I really liked how my ice used to be tasteless AND clear...BUT the brita filter isn't bad... some of the ice blocks are somewhat clear, and whats important is that the water tastes good still....

These filters work perfectly with my Brita water pitcher.  I had bought an off brand filter in the past and it took soooo long for the water to pour through the filter into the pitcher.  It was ridiculous.  I have learned my lesson though and bought the Brita brand instead now.  The water runs right through so much quicker now!

I've got a triple-pack for our new pitcher. Just as before, the filters work very well to provide us with fresh-tasting water. Now the only difference is that our new pitcher has higher capacity, so we can have more of the good stuff. These filters are a MUST for all who enjoy Brita Water Filter Pitchers. :)

Great value for three filters. Easy to replace, and apparently they can fit in ALL of the Brita brand pitchers, so if I get a bigger pitcher or if my current one breaks, etc, I'm not wasting the filters.I can't stand the taste of my tap water, so I mostly use these filters for flavor reduction. (Note: These filters are NOT for contaminated water, or any water that is not already considered safe to drink.)

Update of previous review:  This filter lasted 2 months (instead of 3 months) when we noticed serious slowing of the water being filtered into pitcher.  Will return to monthly filters.Hoped to save energy. Possibly water.Brita Longlast Replacement Filters for Pitchers and Dispensers - BPA Free - 1 Count

I've had a Brita Pitcher for about 7 years now and still like the water quality.  There are other better filter sets out there, but this removes most of the chlorine taste and smell from city water which is good for me.  Easy to tell the difference if you drink a glass of plain tap water.  Rather inexpensive too for what it does.  Good price on these filters, slightly cheaper than in stores.
NA

I like this product to the extent it goes with the Brita Pitcher.  Filters are easy to install and well worth it to get great tasting water for little to no cost.  I would recommend this and the pitcher to any and all that are looking for an inexpensive way to get great tasting and good for you water without all the added yuk that comes through the pipes.

I couldn't more pleased with the Brita filter results. I live in Scottsdale, AZ the tap water is very hard and often has a distinct sulfur odor due to the fact most of the water is stored in and pumped out of aquifers below the city . Living in a second floor of a flat, I have been hefting bottled water for years, recently I purchased the Brita pitcher figuring the most I could lose is $25 if it didn't make a difference.  It has performed beyond my expectations and in the two months I have had it, it has paid for itself (case of store water at $3 a week times eight weeks).  I am now purchasing three filters for $12, the math is easy on this, I am way ahead of the game and my back is happy too.

Love my Britta, these filters are super easy to install.  I wish there was some place to record when you changed it last, or just remind me when to change it.  I love how they do not leave little charcoal bits floating in your water.  They are quite economical, especially compared to purchasing filters for your refrigerator.  If I didn't need that one for ice, I would do with out, and just use my britta

Great and Easy to use replacements. I keep these around all the time as I use my Britas filters daily.I have ordered many of them, and never had any problems.-They are easy to open and usedBE SURE TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS- SOAK THE FILTER BEFORE USEThis will eliminate black specks floating in your water.They last for the prescribed amount of gallons of water.They are safely packaged and never tampered with which is important for water filters.Great overall product, saves me tons of money on clean water!

GOOD EVERYDAY PRICE  for  "Advanced "  BRITA  Water Filter Pitcher Replacement  (3-pack) , -  by Brita, .. same price as local retail store,... w/Free Shipping, per Amazon Minimum Order.  Like the  Newer  "Advanced"  Non pre-soak, Brita Filters,  ...* Per Instructions on each individually packaged filter :  " Rinse with Cold Water for 15 seconds, prior to use.  Carbon Dust Common 1 - 3 Fills".  A Satisfied Customer :)

I have been using Brita filter for over a year now and had issues with the previous version of the filters. The filters would be difficult to install and I would often see some black partciles(which were carbon particles by the way and Brita mentioned it was no issue). However, these new version ones are easier to install and I do not see any partciles anymore. Thumbs up for the price. Even the compatible ones(which are not as good) are not this cheap.

Really like what the filters do; even though my water in the refrigerator is run through a filter, it still tasted wrong to me.  When I use the brita filters with regular tap water or the water from my refrigerator dispenser it finally tastes okay.  The chlorine is pretty strong where we live and is likely to get stronger as a new law in Texas requires that cities begin using more and more surface water.  Anyway, these filters solved my problem; I'm using the Brita Grand Water Filter Pitcher.

If anything, Brita pitchers are underrated. These filters are essential to making yours work. At 60 days per filter, the purchase took me all of 5 seconds to click the add to cart button. It sure beats lugging those cases of bottled water through supermarkets and you don't know what's really in those bottles anyway.We don't even need to talk about the environmental "green" aspects of using these over the bottled stuff either.

Works great but not after so many refills. It says change filter every 3 months but after refilling the water up after 4th refill it starts tasting like it stopped filtering. Not sure if it's just my water but it still helps. Will be trying another filter though. But all around still very good price. Replacement filters can be a little expensive depending on where you get it and how many.

These Brita Water filters are much less expensive than I find in local stores. Ordering in bulk sure has its perks! My Brita pitcher has been around for a few years and it still is making clean and tasty drinking water with the help of these filters. The water is very chlorinated where I live and these do a perfect job of taking that nasty taste out of the water.Make sure to follow the instructions and place the filter in a glass of water for a few minutes before use. It helps to wash away some of the loose carbon that may be in the filter.

I have been using bottled water for several years - refilling the bottles periodically at our local Wal-Mart. Then I got a Brita pitcher and found that I could have well filtered water at a fraction of what I had been spending. I now use my Brita-filtered water exclusively for cooking and drinking - the three pack filters from Amazon are inexpensive (and less expensive than I can find them locally) - and do an excellent job. I don't even try to keep track of how much water goes through each one. I use one for a month and then replace it. If you have any doubts about the quality of the drinking water where you live, I strongly recommend that you get a Brita and a supply of filters from Amazon.

Even though my township claims our water is good and passes all tests the smell of chlorine and the red stains are disgusting. We use our Brita for all our water needs like drinking, cooking, dog's water and especially coffee. Filters are expensive but work well. I will continue to purchase.

I thought I had received defect. After cleaning the filter for 30 seconds, I put it in the pitcher. The taste and smell of tap water was still there even after dumping much of the remaining water and cleaning the filter over and over. I would not buy these from this seller....ever.

Me and my girlfriend couldn't live without our brita filter. It makes water taste so much better then tap or well water. We change our filter about every 3-4 months and the amount that these cost is well worth enjoying drinking water. We use the filtered water for drinking, cooking, and giving to our pets.

These filters do the job, I assume, they say they are doing. I live in a university dorm and the water from our sink is less than optimal in my opinion. To help combat the taste and chlorine smell, I bough the filter and a pitcher and have been getting non-smelly, unclorinated water which I love. The reason I took off one star is because of two reasons:You need to replace the filter when your water does not taste nor smell "clean", do not always go by the indicator light on your pitcher. It's simply "pour sensitive" and just counts how many times you pour water from the pitcher and eventually says you need to change it.2) Despite following directions not to pour water directly onto the filter during filling, large specks of carbon like to detatch from the filter and float around inside the filtering basin. Not that big of a deal, but not awesome either.Overall I am very satisfied with my filter and encourage the use of this product to help reduce plastic bottle waste.

The filters are working fine for improving the taste of city water, and I haven't noticed much carbon residue if any in my water. I don't think the Brita pitcher is a very robust water cleaning system, but it does seem to work as advertised.Even though the style of this filter looks different from what I had been buying previously--the shape of the top has changed--it fits my pitcher the same as my previous filters.

They function quite well for removing chlorine smell from city water but I had to remove at least one star for slight false advertising.  This product works less like a water filter and more like a water softener.  Very little filtering is actually done which is unsurprising considering how fast the water goes through.  This product functions mostly as an ion exchange system that removes dissolved ions in the water or binds to them to form better-tasting salts (I would guess Magnesium Chloride)  If your water contains anything remotely harmful I would not rely on a Brita filter to help you, if you want your water to taste better, than I would highly recommend this.

One of my filters kept floating in the pitcher.  First time that's ever happened to me.  Kept mixing the filtered and non filtered water - totally missing the point of having it in there.  I tried everything to get that air bubble out over the course of a week.  Gave up and threw it out.  The second one I opened works great.

so I own the Brita Stainless Steel Water Filter Pitcher, 8 Cup, and I purchased these Brita filters saying they fit all Brita pitchers, apparently Brita has changed the design. Well, they do not fit my pitcher. So I will be returning them with one of them being wet (cause you have to rinse it out before using). I really hope that the generic ones I ordered to replace these ones will fit.

I love my Brita water pitcher, but no one else fills it up but me.  My grand daughters think my water is delicious and do not care about drinking fruit flavored sugary juices.  One problem is, since they have been staying with me temporarily one of them loosens the filter to fill up the pitcher because it is quicker.  I can tell the difference.

It's easy to use (just rinse it and go), makes the water taste great, and filters SUPER quickly. Plus they were at a good discount when I got the 2-pack. We have very hard water here that I can't stand to drink from the tap, and this makes such a difference! I've also noticed far fewer black carbon particles at the bottom of the pitcher than with the old style Brita filters

They filter the gross dorm water to be clean and taste bright/fresh, and fit into all of the different Brita pitchers that exist in my dorm. Great price that is unbeatable by other stores, and I like having 3 at once so I know I have a backup. The package arrived a bit damaged from shipping because they sent the box in an envelope, which was concerning.

Worked fine for about 1 month and then the filter seems to have clogged up and stopped filtering. Suspect a big design flaw compared to the regular lasting filters especially since the water also seems to get filtered much slower in comparison. I am now out of the return/replacement window and will have to suck up the cost.Considering the significantly higher cost, the regular Brita filters are a much better option overall.

I originally bought a Brita pitcher when we lived in an area with a municipal water supply. I can't stand the smell or taste of chlorine and the Brita Advanced Replacement Filters did a good job of filtering that out. We now live in an area with great water, but it does have some excess mineral content. These filters do a good job of filtering some of that stuff out too, leaving behind, fresh, pure, clean water.

Only one out of three actually fit properly. There were two that fit so poorly that the lid on my pitcher didn't fit. The water was only partially filtered because the filters would leak around where it fits into water basin.  I purchased a new filter from a store in town.  It fit perfectly.  Frustrated with my purchase from this seller.

This seems to have less overall filtering effect than the regular filters. I can taste more of the chlorine in the tap water with this filter. Disappointing! Here I was expecting to save money, but all I did was drink less water due to the bad taste. Makes me consider switching to a different brand all together, since the regular filters have such a short life span, and this one doesn't filter out the taste.

For some reason these are of less quality and simply float up when the pitcher is getting full.  I followed all instructions provided.  I even tossed one thinking it was a unique issue (have been using Britta for years);  second one (new) is acting the same way.  Only short time solution is to not allow the pitcher to get past 3/4 full.  Dissapointed at the (low) quality of these filters.

These seem to work well with our Brita Classic.  We have another model we will be trying them out on as it is a larger size.  We started getting iron in our water as we have a well and when it rained a lot, the well would rise and dip into a layer of soil that had iron in it.  This filters out that iron and who knows what else quite well.

Just plain too expensive for a plastic tube of charcoal.  But the generics I've tried don't seat well into the pitcher and tend to leak water through without filtering it.  So in short, the genuine Brita filters do indeed work better than the generics, but are excessively priced for what they are.

We use these filters in our slim pitcher - We started when we supplemented our son with formula while I was getting my supply up, but we now use Brita filtered water for cooking and drinking - In a family of three, we find we have to change the filter every two months.

These are wonderful. They last for approximately 2 months, and improve the taste, content and appearance of your water.I had a serious sulphur problem wth my water. When heated, it smelled bad enough to make you gag. There was enought sulphur in the water to cause some stomach upset.I am only renting, and did not want to go to any great expense for such a hopefully short term problem. Unfortunately, the problem proved to be long lasting. A friend solved the problem with the Brita Classic water pitcher. You change the filters every 2 months, and you're good to go. It's easy to clean,too.

Can't beat that new filter taste right out of the fridge.I admit, we use our filters waaaaaaay longer than they are supposed to since we use them mostly for taste since our water tastes pretty bad, but I really like these suckers. Plus the new design seems to make replacing them easier and cut down on the black floaters.They also run the water through really fast, so you are only about a minute away from an easy pour for a new glass if you just refilled it.Got the 3 pack and will probably last us a while.

I love my Brita! Taste like the water from a water bottle. I use it daily so I change my filter every month and a half. The instructions state every four months I believe but I'd rather be safe than sorry. Only reason it is not getting five starts is because the packaging was a mess. Looked as if the mail carrier threw it out the moving vehicle to my porch (which may or may my be the case) (SARCASM) but overall I do plan to purchase again.

I WOULD GO LOWER THAN A ONE STAR IF I COULD BUT I CAN'T.  THE NEW FILTER DON'T SEAL WITH THE GRAND PITCHER IN DIFFERANT COLORS AT ALL BUT IF YOU USE THE OLD STYLE THEY FIT PERFECT WITH NO PROBLEM. MY FILTERS LAST ME THREE MONTHS BECAUSE THIER IS JUST TWO OF US.  THE WARRANTY IS NO GOOD BECAUSE IT IS TO LATE BY THE TIME YOU NEED TO PUT THE NEW FILTERS IN.

This filter is garbage.  Water streams through it almost instantly.  After it's filtered. the water tastes like a dirty pool.  AND I find pieces of charcoal floating in the bottom of of each glass.  The seller does not do refunds, so I emailed Amazon.  Problem solved. DEMAND YOUR MONEY BACK IF YOUR FILTER IS DEFECTIVE.

I was in the market to replace my overdue Brita filter. Buying two was definitely cheaper than one, especially compared to local stores. I could immediately taste a difference once I replaced it. I initially filled my Brita all the way, let it filter, poured that water out, and then refilled it with new water before I tasted the water, just to break it in and get rid of any tastes and particles that might've gotten into the packaging. At first, it was a little difficult aligning the filter into the Brita, but once the ridges connected, it stayed in place. Having a Brita definitely is environmentally friendly, and with it, you can pour tap water and still get the same taste from a bottle of water!

Here's a review from somebody that wasn't compensated and paid full price!  Maybe it's just me but getting a Brita was one of the best things I ever did for myself.  These replacement filters work as promised and, for just a household of two, last a bit longer than the instructions list.  They are well worth the continuing investment to make water and everything cooked in it taste better.

These filters work awesome.  I live in a little rural community and never feel safe drinking the water.  I always use my Brita pitcher for everything that I am going to drink.  These filters have improved over the older versions, in that there is no little black particles floating around.  The water is crystal clear and tastes so clean and fresh.  Thank you Brita for the improvements and for easing my mind.

These are cheaper than the Britta filters but they also take about 5 times as long to filter the water. So far they work but slow. Takes about 20 minutes to fill the pitcher vs. 4 minutes with the Britta originals.UPDATE after a month of using, these are worthless. They stop filtering water all together after about 20 uses. Keep the top of the Britta filter full of water and make it dump all over you as it just did to me now.JUNK! DO NOT BUY.

They work in even our older 10+ year old pitcher so we're happy with these replacements.  I was a little worried at first since they look different and figured Brita changed the design just to force people into buying new pitchers but nope, just looks different.

I am having a problem with these filters.  Have been using them correctly, changing them every 60 days, without problem.  My next change date is 9/11/15.  This morning it looks like green algae at the bottom of my pitcher.  I've tried many things and cannot get it to go away.  Perhaps the filter is faulty?  I will have to change it ahead of schedule.  I'm the only one using the pitcher and drink 64 oz. of water five days a week.  Your input would be greatly appreciated.  Thank you

I bought this to use with my Brita Water Jug. Usually the ones you buy from Walmart will cost you more but I saw this awesome deal from Amazon and snagged it right away. I have always been against using packaged water bottles and try to minimize my use whenever possible.At my home, the water has a different taste in spite of having a water softener. For the sake of my family, I wanted to get a water filter but did not want to spend hundreds at once on installing one.The Brita water jug holds about 3 gallons, enough for all of us during dinner. This filter works well and I am happy to drink good tasting water again. If Amazon keeps giving these awesome deals, I will most certainly buy these from them.
The Brita system is easy to use and cheaper than buying bottled water. These cartridges can easily be swapped out in a variety of Brita products.

I use the Brita to make my water from distiller taste crisp and yummy as the filters that came with distiller just didn't quite give it that crisp taste. They r good at making water taste good even if they don't really remove anything that's bad in the water on any level that counts, but does make it taste much better so thumbs up there. Price as the exact same at grocery store so not a deal that way but I ordered sat am and was shocked to see it delivered sat afternoon. Same day, you get 5 stars

I finally for a new pitcher since I wanted a BPA free pitcher. Years ago PURR was better...and their filters were the worst!!! Lasted 3 weeks...thses are so much better than PURR. Same thing but last as they should approx 2 months. SO happy I changed to Brita!

Nice set for a nice price, but so far one of the filters has proven to be defective in that the water that goes through it goes right through and does not seem to be doing any filtration in our Britta filter. I was able to partially resolve it by taking the filter out (after having ran several cycles of water through it) and rapping it roughly against our kitchen counter. Now the water seems to be taking a reasonable amount of time to filter through. Hoping the rest of the set is not as defective.

Maybe I got a bad batch. Some numbers, tap water PPM about a 170 reading, it tastes very good. Original Brita Ultramax reduced it to 110, that was OK. Bottled spring water ranges from 10 to around 50. However, tried all 3 of these Brita replacement, they each gave a reading about the SAME as the tap, some slightly HIGHER!? You'd think "Brita" replacement filters would work as well as their original.

Only bought these 'cause many reviews indicate generic replacements are very inconsistent in quality. Still kicking myself for using Brita in the first place since there is no claim that these extract harmful chemicals or pathogens. Just make the questionable water 'taste better.' Cheaper than bottled water, but only marginally with respect to Brita pricing.

Buyer beware...these do not fit ALL Brita pitchers. I have a green topped Brita pitcher, I soaked this filter got ready to use it and it will not fit the pitcher. Disappointing and now I have to go through the process of sending these back. My pitcher has side grooves on opposite sides, this filter will not fit down into it due to these side grooves.

I like that it's longer lasting. However they easily pop up and water just goes through without being filtered. There should be a way to prevent this. I am using them in a regular Brita pitcher and the Brita UltraMax large dispenser. Both have this filter problem.
Unfortunately, these replacement filters are advertised to fit all Brita pitchers. They don't fit mine and were therefore a disappointing waste of money.

Half the filters didn't work. They didn't fit into the slot properly, and either floated when water was added, or didn't let enough water through. Not sure how this is possible, since they were all brita filters, and theoretically the same, but here we are.

I wish I could leave this zero stars. Ever since Brita changed their filters things have gone downhill. Before this our water tasted really good from our pitcher then they went to these new and improved filters which is a joke, and now our water tastes like salt and chlorine. The bottom of the filter has a disgusting smell after two weeks. We have stopped using this pitcher sadly, because we loved it, and we will never buy anything else from Brita. We are going to look in two different alternatives now. Beware. Don't waste your money on these if you have this pitcher!!!!!! We tried all three and all three filters were disgusting after following the instructions!! For the sake of your health get something different!!!

I have been extremely happy with my Brita container.  I usually use the white filters. I like the fact that these blue filters last longer and filter additional substances. I was happy before, these make me even more satisfied and I like the economy.

I don't love that you are supposed to discard several pitchers of water each time you replace the filter, but I have yet to find a better option. So 4 stars.  These are easy to put in and I do love Brita pitchers - I keep 2 in my fridge so one is always full/cold!

After several quality issues consisting of mostly non-uniform filtration filtering flow (one filter worked quickly, another took twice as long to allow water to pass through), I wrote the company. One filter seemed s though there was no charcoal at all in it, as the water ran through so fast and it didn't "taste" filtered. These cost too much to get even one bad filter in  three pack. I have used over two dozen of these and understand what I am implying. The Brita customer service treated me as if I was a moron, but spoke as if she herself wasn't even familiar with the product.

I had the same Brita filter holder in my fridge for a long time. You don't see them in the stores, as they usually have the pitchers. When I saw this on Amazon, I bought it immediately. My old one still functioned, but showed it's age. When I opened the box I thought it looked smaller, but it's the same volume, just in a cleaner, streamlined container.  Yes, I really, really recommend it!!!

Sadly, Water was awful, returned and got new ones from Costco.  Unlike the ones that came with water kit, the water went out of the filters fast, and also unlike the the very good water from kit, water was awful  from these something was just wrong.

The carbon dust appeared continually even though I tried to add cold tap water over than 3 pitchers. Then, I threw away one of them, and I replaced another one to use for now. I am looking for it is going to be fine or not.
Love my Brita pitcher and this new design filter fits perfectly even in my much older Brita pitcher.  Easy to use and water tastes wonderful.

1. When the pitcher is empty, you should refill the reservoir right away.2. When the pitcher is full or partly full, the bottom of the filter is keeping moist.3. The filter does not need to be soaked and flushed exactly according to directions.4. You may have specks of charcoal in the water if you do not flush the filter.3. Only use cool or cold water through the filter.These filters work as advertised.  We bought through Amazon only because of convenience of delivery.

Don't waste your money on the cheap imitations of these filters. What they don't tell you is that you need to change them out EVERY MONTH, instead of every two months, like you do with these filters. So where is the savings, if you have to use twice as many of them? I would rather pay just a little more and know that I'm getting a quality product - the gaskets on the imitations were dirty, which made me think they weren't very safe to begin with - like i said, at least I know I'm getting the real deal when I buy these.  No more imitation water filters for me!

If you're looking for these filters, the odds are good you already ought to have an idea of the Brita water filter system. I live in NYC and we have some of the best tap water in the nation, so each one of these filters seems to last me 6-9 months before I start noticing a difference between filtered and straight out of the tap water. I also keep my Brita fridge so the cold might help it last longer(less bacteria growth). Yes, there are tiny flakes of carbon/charcoal that makes it way past the screen on the first couple of fillings, but they aren't toxic and doesn't affect the taste at all #firstworldproblems

Exactly what I was looking for. Buying 3 at a time allows me to change the filter as recommended instead of holding out until I have a chance to go to the store.The water in my apartment comes out yellowish or rusty at times. I had it tested and there's no lead or iron, must be something else non toxic. But either way, Brita filters completely remove this contaminant and give me clear, delicious water to drink. Thanks Brita!
First time trying these. When pre-soaking, they automatically sink, which is nice (as opposed to putting a bowl over them to prime them). I'd buy them again.

So far am very pleased with this long lasting filter.  It is SO nice not having the bits of charkole in the water!!  Time will tell if it really cleans the water for 6 months.  The water flows thru the filter very well - much like the old ones.

I inherited a Brita Water Filter Pitcher and didn't know how old the filter was.  I started to use it after moving from a home with great tasting well water with an RO filter into a new home that had a chlorinated city water supply.  I wasn't impressed with the filtered water quality but after installing a new filter there was a dramatic improvement in the taste of the water. It wasn't nearly as good as the RO water but was passable when refrigerated. Note that some of the higher quantity packages have a higher per unit cost.

I bought these in bulk on here for the reason of saving a little money then buying them in smaller packets at the store. I use these filters at home in a big Brita container and they work good. I think the quality of water is good overall. If you read many of the reviews of the product you see the problems you can run into. My only two things I dislike about the product is the fact that you can sometimes get charcoal in the water which I don't like, and then also the older models you have to presoak.Other than that these are great and well worth the buy since two of us in the household mainly drink just water it comes in handy. I would trade up from regular tap water or well water to this if you can. The water tastes much better.

I have a Brita water pitcher up at our cabin as the water quality isn't the best there. I used to buy these filters at Walmart but they stopped carrying them so now I order them online. Super easy to fit - not like the older ones where you literally had to work them in just so and soak them for X amount of minutes - these are just rinse under cold water for 15 seconds and plop into place and you are good to go!! Wouldn't be without them!

doesn't fit regular britta counter top dispenser. too late to get my money back . the bottom is flat with a little round indent on the bottom. picture shows the one side and I expected it all to have those indents to fit over the filter hole

I like this filter. Reading what it could filter. I use it in combination with the normal Brita filter. I would use this fiter first then with all the filtered water, I pour it into anothe pitch (with the normal filter). There is a difference in the water.However, the whole filtering process for Longlast is just way too slow. It takes over an hour to do  one pass of filtration. That's just not acceptable.  The first 10 days of use, the filter was fine but now (the filter has only been used for 1 month), it is filtering literary one drop of water every second.For filter: I give it a 4 stars. For speed: 1 star. So overall,

These from Amazon do not stay seated in my Brita pitcher.  Mine is not the largest, it holds less than a gallon, but I've never had any other filters "float out of place" when the pitcher was full.  Its VERY annoying as I have to keep the pitcher half full and I like to keep it full all the time.  No more online Brita filters.  I think they're outdated or something else - are they genuine?  Who knows?

I like the Brita filters for my Brita. I did try generic filters and they just don't work as well. I can count on the Brita filters to keep my water fresh tasting. I save quite a bit of money using my Brita instead of buying bottled water.

Love my brita filter my town water sucks has such a high level and smell of chlorine its really unbearable out of the tap. These filters a savour no need to run and buy water at the store. Saves me tons and they last so long highly recommended

Real Brita filters at a great price. I had ordered some imitation "Brita" filters by mistake and Amazon found the real ones at a great price and let me keep the imitations.I've used both. The Brita's are the same great product they've always been. The imitations did not fit as well into my pitcher and they were actually more expensive than the real Brita!Stay with the real Brita.

I was skeptical about buying these "new" replacement filters for my Brita pitcher, as they are not the same as the classic ones I was using.  So I bought the 2 pack to try them out.  I love them!  They have much faster flow through that the classic ones. The taste is exceptional & I will be ordering them in bulk from now on.

This is a great idea!  I received two filters for one low price. Every four months I receive two more!  These filters are much more expensive in the store so I found myself letting the filters going much longer than was good. Now I can change the filter every two months and have fresh ones arrive in my mail at a lower price. I can enjoy fresh filtered water and save some money. What could be better than that??!!

I have continued purchased Brita filters for almost 5 years. Recently, I don't know why the first time use the water is blackish (carbo leakage?). Also, sometimes when I poured the water, the filter came off. Hope this can be fixed.
