I am a reformed Aquasana user.  The filters are so expensive and they keep going up every year!  These filters work very well. They filter out the nastiness in our Southern California water.  We can usually 'see' our water when it comes out of the tap.  It's disgusting.  Filtered with these in my Brita pitcher and the water is clear.  It tastes great too!  One filter will last for 50 to 60 pitcher refills (or about two months).  Buy these every six months and enjoy clear, refreshing water for 6 months for $15.

I ordered the original Britta for my original Britta filter system, but got these instead. I did not pitch a fit, too much trouble, and funny how a complaint can get political in a heart beat, so I wrapped the filter in landscape tape, added an o ring and it works well. Be careful you order the right filter for your system, or get creative, too.

i live in NY, and we have the best quality tap water in the entire country, but still chlorine makes it weird.. With this filter, water is odorless and easy to drink. Somehow it makes you drink more water..strongly recommend it. I change it every four months..and this package option is the best deal you can find in the market.

I don't know how long some of you have had Brita pitchers/filters, etc., but those things used to be so slow. I don't know what Brita has done to their design, but these filter way faster than the old ones do. Definitely worth the extra few bucks to not buy generic ones.

As for the taste, I imagine that depends on the original source of the water and one's own subjective taste preferences, but I think the water that comes out of my pitcher tastes great. I live in NJ, and have always thought that the water tastes a bit too much like chlorine, and the Brita filtration makes the water taste much better than drinking it from the tap.

So happy with these filters, and I especially like the price.  In-store prices are getting so high, and you only usually get 4 filters.  I love having filtered water, but it can get costly.  So glad I found these filters on Amazon.

One of the two filters was bad. It filtered very slowly and, when I added water too quickly, popped out. It never did seal properly, as far as I can tell. We have very bad water here and I have been having stomach problems since I put in this filter. I finally made the connection between my health and this filter and replaced it.

The last two times I've purchased filters for my Brita Pitcher through Amazon, they do not fit the pitcher perfectly which mean the water is passing through without being filtered.  Is anyone else experiencing this?

It may last 3 times as long as the normal filter but it takes 10 times as long to filter water. Water comes out as drips not as the smooth stream from the regular filter and takes an hour to empty the reservoir into the pitcher. Not worth it, more hassle than help.

These things are awesome. I use them to filter cheap gutrot vodka into something far more palatable. I use one filter for every half-gallon of liquor, which easily saves me $40+ over buying a top shelf bottle at the store. Put it in an old top-shelf bottle, bring it to a party, and you friends won't know the difference.

The filters are effective and fit into my Brita Atlantis. However, the filters do not accommodate the filter "Change" meter. I will return and replace with appropriate filters which may only be availible at an affordable price outside of the Amazon system. I was hoping to reorder my previous filter order but they are no longer available from the same Amazon vendor.

These are easier to use than the old filters but still fit in the old pitchers. The curved top makes them easier to put in and pull out, they stay in place better than the old ones, don't require the pre-soak, and don't leave as many black specks in the bottom of the pitcher. You are still supposed to run water through several pitcher's worth and dump it out when using for the first time.

These Brita replacements are indeed a one size fits all filter for Brita Pitchers, and at the moment 1 filter costs the same as a case of bottled water. Although seeing as how its only activated carbon in the filter they aren't going to give you as great tasting water as say a bottle of spring water.I only use my Brita pitcher for mixed powdered drinks where you get the added filtration from the faucet but the taste is disguised with whatever you're mixing it with. They cannot replace bottled water for drinking, at least for my taste.
Brita brand filters just seem to taste better than the knockoffs. Be careful which vendor you buy from though. If it's too good to be true, it probably is.

We went far too long without replacing our Brita water filter, but when I bought this package and replaced it:  A Miracle!  The water flows through so quickly. We love the taste of our water after it has been through the Brita. I will always buy this from Amazon in the 3 pack from now on, so we can replace the filter whenever we need.

We've been using Brita for a few years now keep our family a tad bit more "green" as opposed to buying the bottled waters like we used to. The price of these replacement filters is great. I love having several on hand :)

I live in DC with old water pipes. After some research found out that these Brita drip filters don't really filter lead or anything else that seriously.Also used a water tester, found that Brita filtered water has around 160 ppm compared to our unfiltered water that's around 220-250 ppm.The Zero water filters seem to work best for me, their water tests as 0 ppm and there's online reports that confirm it.

I was using some off brands that were not that great. These are genuine and are a new design that lets the water filter through faster than when I first bought my pitcher. Very pleased with the product and the price
NA

Great bottle, still looks brand new but about a month after using it a smell developed and i can't seem to get it out of the bottle. It's like a mix between clorien and mold, no matter how much I wash it the smell won't quit. So I stopped using it about a month after I bought it.

I hate buying bottled water for two reasons- cost and the plastic that we use and throw away. So I use my Brita pitcher for all my water-drinking, ice cubes, adding to any beverage such as tea and coffee, espresso. Takes out the nasty chlorine taste and smell as well as many microbes we cannot see. I feel it is much better for you than tap water.
NA

The redesigned top looks like it'll let water flow through faster, and it seems to do that. These don't seem to fit tight in the upper chamber of the pitcher, so over filling might cause the filter to float, which would mix the filtered water with unfiltered water. (Pur fixed this problem by using a threaded filter with an o-ring seal.) We'll see how long these charcoal filters last before plugging up.

Great filters which provide great drinking water with no after taste. I do recommend providing about three different filtered pitchers of water for a new filter to "break in" as any less can result in funny tasting water. 3 times seems to be the sweet spot. I do have overly hard water with no water softener so otheres may have greater success with less filtering prior to drinking the water.

Saves me from buying plastic bottles, water tastes good as well.Tip: To use these properly, keep a tab of how much water you consume, it does sound very butt in the pain kind of thing to keep a tab on, however, by doing that you can make sure you use it the way its supposed to and replace it on time. For us, we refill the Brita container with half gallon pitcher every other day and know that we gotta replace the filter every 40 gallon.

The filter does its job. The timer in the carafe itself is not okay. According to the filter, it can filter up to 300 bottles. The timer reminds you after three months independently on the volume of water you filtered.

fits the pitcher we also purchased, easy to install in pitcher.  I'd like to test the water before and after going thru this filter, another thing to get done.  So I cannot attest to how well these filter water, but fits well in the pitcher.

I followed the instruction like it said and everything turns out great! The water taste so clean and fresh. It no longer tasted like tap water when I didn't switch out the old one for two years (Yuck! I know lol). I am very happy with my purchase and will purchase it again when I run out of it.

Brita is a life saver living in a city with awful tasting water. These replacement filters work great a last longer than the little timer says they do. i keep them in until the water tastes like tap water then replace them. I have had no issues with these filters losing the carbon inside like i did with older brita filters

Sometimes the Brita filters deposit a fine coating of their charcoal on the bottom of the pitcher, regardless of whether it's been soaked beforehand. It's a simple procedure to remove the filter and wipe out, but if you don't watch for it, eventually you'll notice a distinctly unpleasant taste to your water. That being said, when that doesn't happen, your tap water will essentially have no taste. Your coffee, tea, etc., will taste better as a result.

sparkling water for pennies, why on earth do people pay outrageous prices for bottled water??? a Brita  filter gives you perfect water at a  fraction of the price and  why fight traffic and pay for gas?? come on people, Its much cheaper and you can relax at home while dummies lug heavy cases of over priced water to their cars .......

I did the boil test after I used my filter and there was zero reside left in the Pyrex pot when I was done.  My water tastes wonderful.  I use my filtered water to grow Kefir and Kubucha and if there was any chlorine left in the water it could kill my growths.  My drinks are healthy and wonderful. so I know the chlorine is removed completely.  Plus my water now tastes wonderful.  I have been using one filter an entire month,.  I filter at least a gallon a day, and so far I have not had to change it.  I am very pleased.

I've had a Britta pitcher for years. This is the first time I ordered filters from Amazon. The first filter gave the water a sweet taste. We thought it would go away. It actually changed the taste. After three weeks we threw it away. The second filter still changed the taste but not so much. I don't know what Britta did to their filters but for the money you pay you would think they would provide better ones.

This product is what it says it is, and does an excellent job making my pretty awful tap water taste good. I find the filters generally work well enough to handle 2 or 3 filterings a day for about 4 months or so before there is any noticeable degradation.

These will perform as expected I hope. The one that came with the pitcher is doing a remarkable job in giving my water a nice, non odiferous taste, certainly not the creek water taste that comes out of my tap. But my water company tries, they really do.

These are WAY better than the old model. No need to soak these you just rinse them for a while. There is no black carbon flakes from these like the old ones how they used to add up in the tank. These don't seep carbon at all. I also noticed my water tastes better with these ones. Idk if it's in my head but if it tastes better to me then I'm not complaining :)

Every time it comes to replace the filters I forget to buy them. Probably more so because they are extreme overpriced at the grocery store. Luckily I can order them online now, and they are so much more cost efficient. We love our Brita Water Filter and am always surprised how much $#it it filters out. Amazing to think that out tab water is so dirty. Thanks to Brita filters our water tastes refreshing and is clean, we trust the makers for years. Thank you.

I want to start out by saying that I love the taste that Brita water filters imbue into tap water. It's crisp, clean, and smooth.I should have heeded the warnings in the reviews. The plastic bag around each individual filter looked faded and old. I soaked the filter twice for about 20 minutes each run. It fit very well into the filter slot, and it leaked the normal amount of carbon I'm used to seeing.It wasn't until I tried the second round of water that my husband noticed the filtered water tasted a bit more like tap than we are normally used to. Maybe this batch is very old. It tastes like it's filtering at 50% efficiency. Just a head's up.

Poor product. After 3 months of filling a 10-cup capacity water pitcher no more than twice daily the filter operates so slowly that I can fill it only one time a day, at night before I go to bed because it takes all night to process that little amount of water. And I'm filling it with water from my kitchen faucet, not some muddy watering hole in the bush.

I will definitely purchase these Brita filters again. This is a great value for the price. I searched other places, but this was the most reasonable price for three filters. They are exactly the same filters I've purchased from a larger retailer, and they work great. Also, they arrived in a timely. I have already recommended these filters to several of my friends.

these new improved filters are soooo much better than the older ones. No comparison at all.  the old ones you had to soak for 15 minutes then rinse several times and throw out the first few pitchers of water.  With the new ones, you just rinse them and put them in - you probably should throw out the first two pitchers of water, but there are no black carbon particles like the old ones.  Definite improvement

These are going to save me hundreds of dollars a year in bottled water.  I drink 40 to 50 ounces a day plus this makes the coffee taste great over city water. Just sorry I did not get Brita and the replacement years ago.Seldom more impressed with a product!

This is 4 stars because it does what I expect it to do ... easy to follow directions on preparing the filter ... clean water.  It's less a star because these filters do not last very long -- per their recommendation.  I should add that I do not change them as often as the package says.  Now, I would have given this 3 stars, however, I am a believer that if I use something again, it deserves recommendation.  Yes, although the filter calls for more frequent changes than I'd like, I WILL be buying more of these.  I'm comfortable with the brand and with the security I feel when drinking the water it filters.

I absolutely love Brita.  I think this was a stroke of genius to make a pitcher that filters water.  It may not be purified but you don't need to run a bunch of tests to find out that it removes chlorine and heavy metals.  A simple taste test will do.  There is just no comparison in the taste of tap water versus charcoal filtered water.  I've been using these filters and pitchers since they first appeared on the shelves.  It's so convenient to grab a pitcher and fill it up and have fresh tasting water within a minute.

I have had no problems with these. I keep them in my Brita much longer than when the little timer on the top tells me to swap them out. I heard some complaints about the new style of the filter, but they work great for me and I actually find them easier to get in/out of the pitcher than the old ones.

I like being able to order these on Amazon instead of trying to hunt them down in the store.  I appreciate the new design where you no longer have to soak the filter before use and it does a great job of keeping the charcoal particles out of the water.  We enjoy using the filtered water for coffee - makes it so much better!

Very good way to save on plastic bottles. If you want to go green, it's a first step. The water in Florida is yellow-ish in my area and Brita filter makes it clear without any aftertaste. And if the water tastes fluorine in your area, because of its high concentration, it will help too (I tried it and it's true). I recommend this buy strongly, Amazon has good prices too, so don't hesitate.
NA

Love these.  They are so much more practical than the old type.  They're easy to remove, don't require soaking, and I never find black particles floating around in the water after filling the pitcher.

I'm grateful for inventions like this! Plus, Brita makes a great product.These work well for cleaning city water for use in my espresso machine so there isn't build up. Filters water, tastes good. The product works like it should and I've never had any issues.
NA

We started using these because the kids complained about the well water in the new house.  They had lived with chlorinated water all their lives, and the well water tasted "flat" to them.  Brita pitchers ended the complaints; I think the filtering gets more oxygen into the water and improves the taste.
the product came damaged,  there was a lot of residue and after more than 30 minutes rinsing the product off it still ran black.

These did not fit into our Brita pitcher. They kept popping out of the slot they go in, and wouldn't stay in place when you poured from the pitcher. Also, they are ineffective, because you can see the water running into the pitcher from the sides, where they should be flush with the slot and not allowing any extra water to pass except through the filters on the bottom.

These work great if you live in a big city like Dallas TX where they junk up the water taste with noxious chemicals. I moved to another state in a rural setting and have a water well. Well water is the way to go if you have the opportunity. Then you wouldn't need a Brita water filter.

I live in Los Angeles, and our tap water does not taste very good to me. I love my brita pitcher, as it quickly and effectively removes any of the junk that might be in the water, and leaves you with much better, cleaner tasting water. These refills work perfectly, and are a very good value for the price being sold by amazon. Occasionally you will get a little black flake in your water from the filter, but it is rare. Very happy with my purchase, and will be ordering this again when its time to replace again in a few months.

These were adequate replacements for the brita filter pitcher.  We don't pay for bottled water, although the city of Baltimore charges nearly as much for faucet water. We've been using brita for years.

Let me start by saying I've been using the large Brita filter for years. The new design of these filters does not sit tightly like the old design. When the tank is filled, the filter floats. Mixing the unfiltered water with the filtered. Rather pointless to use of this is happening.

Love Brita. I recently did a heavy metal detox and am being very cautious about tap water. This has been so helpful. I replace it every 4 months because I use it so often. I have one in the fridge and one on the counter.

After trying an off-brand filter replacement, I'll never go back.  This is one of those things you need to get the brand name for, to be sure your water is filtering and the filter fits snugly in the pitcher.  I bought some other ones at another store and they were so bad that I don't even want to remember what the "eco friendly" brand was called.

Brita filters last for about 3 months, so this will keep me good to go for almost a full year. The price is great on Amazon.. cheaper than you would find in-stores. Love these, very reliable and would recommend.
These work as expected.  It's nice to get them in a two pack because inevitably, we would go to change one and be out.  They fit into my Brita pitcher and come with easy to follow instructions.

Not much to say.  Fits my Brita pitcher and does what it says.  Giving it 4 stars because I think it has a slight charcoal taste but the rest of my family doesn't notice or care.  Very convenient and each filter lasts a while.  Rinse under water, filter water and then dump water a couple of times with each new replacement filter.
We love our Brita Pitcher that we keep full of water in our fridge, but we tend to go through these filters pretty fast. I'm glad I can order them off of Amazon for a very reasonable price.
They are Brita.  My only issue was they came out of the pitcher at times when I was refilling so I had to empty it and start over filling it.  Annoying if I already had filtered water in it.

East installation, good clean tasting water. Nothing else needs saying really. Make sure you do a little math for the best deal per filter.I change my filters every three months instead of the recommended two because I'm only one person using about one full pitcher per day.

I like this new-style brita filter.  They work well.  I had an older filter in my pitcher that I was using this to place, and the difference in taste was noticeable. It also works with the sensor on my pitcher that tells me when to change the filter.  Very good. I will purchase again.

These fit perfectly in my Brita-compatible water pitcher.  They filter well and I am left with very clean drinking water.While they don't require a long soak prior to use, they do need to be rinsed first and will require two to three pitchers-worth of water to pass through to prevent coal dust from showing up in your water.  This is typical of this type of filter.I am satisfied with my purchase.

I do like this design over the old ones. I have been using brita water filters for about 7 years now and I really enjoy them. Buy these in bulk to save money.I have not tried any of the off-brand filters to compare, mostly because the whole worth of the item is in the filter technology.These worked great, fit in my old pitcher no problem, and they seem to filter more efficiently than before (quicker).

Bought these for a water pitcher I previously purchased and it seems that not all of the water is filtering through the filter and it is coming through the sides even though it is in properly. What is the point if it is defective =(

I don't think I have anything new to add to the 2000+ reviews already on here. I have been using the Brita water pitcher and filter for several years now. I agree that our water tastes better. These filters are simple to use and they are an improvement over the older types. I see less carbon residue in the filter cup (actually none so far) than I did with the other ones.
I can't believe I've had this pitcher for 20 years, and that they still make the filters for the original pitcher.  They are incredibly expensive retail, so I'm glad I ordered from here.

These work exactly as they should.  I'm not a fan of bottled water so it's important that my water filters do their job.  I've had my Brita Pitcher for 3-4 years now and have been very pleased with its performance.

This unit is ok at doing it's job but I tell you it often wants to pop out as I'm emptying the water container out. The generic store brand that I use stays in place and that's enough to make me go back it's just annoying.
Disappointed. Bought these to include with a Brita pitcher for a gift, and the box came all mangled and beat up. I was embarrassed to include them in the gift, hopefully they still work.

Brita's newest filtration system is a winner!I've used Brita filters for many many years and I just replaced our system to the newest Pitcher and it makes a huge difference!  No more flaky black specks on the bottom of the filtered water container!  These are easy to use and has revived my confidence in using filtered water versus ordering bottled water.

When you have to chlorinate your well water, you need these to take that taste and smell away. They work perfectly. they last about a month of heavy use, and fit into our pitcher. Makes the water taste sweet like it should.
These are good filters. My only issue is that I occasionally see some black residue underneath them inside the water reservoir.  I can't take it apart to clean it, so it's a little concerning.

I really love having my Brita Walter Filter Pitcher in my fridge and so does my whole family!  We really like how clean the water tastes and having it cold all the time (unless someone forgets to fill it up).  I ordered these.  They didn't look exactly the same as the one that came with our pitcher.  I was worried it may not fit as well.  It fit like a glove!  I'm glad I got the 3 pack.  These will last us for awhile!
takes longer to filter the water than a normal filter.Funny, it says on the packaging "no need to rinse or soak!!"but then, "discard first 3 (or whatever) fills"
These work great with the Brita pitcher filter system. We think the tap water tastes better than bottled now. The three pack makes it easy to replace the filter every couple of months as needed.

What can I say other than it's all about cost with this item. It was less expensive than the market and it's the exact same product. Actually, I've had better luck with these lasting longer... the green button lasts forever it seems and the water tastes really great so it's working.
Been using brita for anlong time now and always looking for a nice deal on those filters. Finally found one and immediately got it. Happy with the price,shipping n service will definitely order again

It filters wonderfully. The price is the cheapest among Britta products. I just moved to a new city and I hate the taste of the water in my neighborhood but with these filters all the bad tastes are gone, I don't even make coffee with tap water. Sooo, yeaah I am one happy customer!

Much better than the previous filter design, the "handle" at the top allows for much easier removal of the old filter when finished. When installing the new one we had a lot of trouble with removing the old stubby top design.Old design:https://www.shopmyexchange.com/products/images/xlarge/9670845_3550.jpg
An easy and cheaper way to get my Brita filters, and a three pack so I always have one around.  Since we can't drink our well water, I have found Brita to be the best choice for our family.

I have a brita max and ordered these new style filters for the first time. There is only 1 way the filter fits snugly and you have to push down, it sounds like the issues people are having are user error. I don't notice any bad taste in the water from the filter. I will buy this product again.
Wonderful filter and better tasting water. I had a few problems at first getting it to fit but it takes a little moving it around. It works people just be patient. I will buy again.
works great as expected. delivered on time.

With this new design Brita should have taken the opportunity to design a filter housing that could house a disposable filtration system.These are not cheap and a serviceable housing with multiple filters would reduce costs and the eco footprint.
When water in the top half of the container is over the top of this filter, it pops out of place and floats, rendering it useless.  I will go back to using the regular Brita filters.

I am very disappointed with the purchase. It is not the same type filter as the original one. The water came through the filter very fast. There are some tiny black things in the water. Don't buy this productIt is waste of money!

I like the new design which removes the need to soak the filters for 15 minutes.  Great improvement.Overall, these perform that same as the old design.  They provide better tasting water for sure.  We can tell the difference when we use the filtered water vs. non-filtered, especially when making coffee and tea.Good product.

Where I live, there is a high sulfur content in the water that makes it not so pleasant to drink.  The Brita Pitcher solves that problem while also filtering out other impurities, and it's SO much more economical than bottled water!  Great to be able to get Brita Replacement Water Filters delivered to my home for LESS than they cost at the big box stores.  Thank you Amazon!

I was worried when buying this NEW AND IMPROVED due to my pitcher being a few years old but these fit perfect and are so much quicker then the old ones. I love it. Water tastes great and filters quick. Make sure to read the instructions on how to prepare it before putting it in though as they have changed since the old ones. Instead of soaking it in water you rinse it with cold water for a few seconds.

I change the filters in my Brita pitchers once a month.  We live in the country, and I can taste the difference as soon as I put a new filter in.  Proof enough for me.  I have three pitchers, one for the cat fountain, one for cooking, and one for drinking.

These taste awful!!!! I have bought multiple sets of brita filters from target before and never had taste issues. However, these produce water that tastes really chemical-like. Not sure if I just got a dud pack or old pack or what but I am not going to be buying filters from Amazon again.
This makes a difference over the standard Brita filters that I can taste. I like the idea that I only have to change it every 90 days so I'm am adding less trash to the waste stream.

I have been using Brita filters for years now. Its the best thing ever! I totally recommend this! I just received my new filters and I don't know why they don't seem to fit very well. I have those standard brita filter jugs and I never had this problem. I feel like the water goes down through the sides  into the jug without being filtered. So some water is filtered and the rest isn't. Anyone else have this problem?

Too lazy to go to the store so I ordered along with other items from Amazon since the price was right.  They're only as good as Brita water filters can be.  I use for water poured directly from my faucet and then pour the Brita filtered water through my Zero-Water pitcher for a really clean and purified zero water.  (I have hard water).

I was a little shocked these arrived in a brown bubble envelope.  The boxed was mashed on one corner but there was no damage to the filters.  Deducted one star for the poor packaging.  Otherwise, product is what I expected and satisfied so far.
This is a good price for these Brita filters. I tried the generic and they take forever to filter the water and sometimes stop in the middle of the process. These work great.
Not sure if these are legit or fake.  Takes literally hours to filter my 8 Cup Brita.  So I have to fill the reservoir before I go to bed for water in the morning.  How is this possible???

Oh my god!  The difference from drinking tap water is outstanding!  I couldn't stand drinking my city water because it had that horrible copper taste.  Luckily I was handed down an old Brita Pitcher from my brother and it needed some filters.  I purchased three of these and expect them to last me a year.  It's really simple to install and use.

I have been wanting to know if the Britta original is a better filter than the generic versions such as Mavea and Wamery. I also wanted to see if the Britta is as good as low cost bottled water. So I purchased a Health Metric TDS (Total dissolved solids) tester from Amazon and set up an experiment.- Each filter is brand new.- Mavea and Britta do not require soaking. I just rinsed each one.- Wamery required soaking and rinsing. I did that according to instructions.- Each filter was used for 2 full pitchers so that they are rinsed.Results:- Ralph's bottled water reads: 3 PPM (Incredibly good)- Britta original filter reads: 262 (this is acceptable drinking water rated as good)- Mavea filter reads: 277 (It is as good as Britta)- Wamery filter reads: 306 (it's still acceptable drinking water, about 20% more than Britta in TDS) so yes, still drinkable.I'm still stunned at how good the cheap bottled water is.

Brita is awesome! I order these filters all the time when they go on sale (Tip: I've ordered these for $4 each on sale, and at walmart they are $8 each!). I have had my 5-cup pitcher and 18-cup dispenser for years. Change your filter monthly for best results! :)

I was buying the generic brand of filters for a while and then returned to these. Now I realize it is definitely worth getting the Brita, as they filter so much quicker and don't require to be soaked prior to use. Water taste clean and fresh!

The instructions say you can use each for about 2 months but is hard for me to believe that as i can already see mud and stones inside the filter. Maybe it still does the job but i am more comfortable to change it every month

This new filter does not taste right. It fits fine, that is definitely not the issue. I follow the directions and it is still not good.  I have used 2 of them already, thinking that the first one might have been faulty, but both taste the same. I drink a lot of water and am very sensitive to the taste and this is not right.It reminds me of well water.I just ordered the old filter, I hope they don't get rid of them completely :(

A MUCH improved design from what has been offered for years. The old product always had loose carbon particles that came loose, mostly in the "fill up chamber" of the picture, but at times also had carbon in the filter part of the picture. Have used two of these so far, they fit better and have seen NO loose carbon anywhere...a nice improvement and a needed one if only from a perception perspective!

I purchased these thinking it would be great not to replace the filter every 2 months. I have been using my new filter less than a week and from the start, it takes more than an hour to filter one standard size pitcher. Usually when using a new one, it filters water pretty quickly and only when it needs to be replaced does it filter slower. This filter started off filtering slower than the standard replacement filters do after months of use.
I bought these for my mama when I bought her pitcher, buying together initially saves money. great product. The unforeseen added bonus is that they  can be used in all our pitchers and we now have 3.
We received the Brita water filter on time and it works perfectly as well. The price is unbeatable, so this purchase was definitely worth it.

I have a Slim Brita 5 cup pitcher and my brother has a Brita 10 cup pitcher. These replacement filters fit great in both and the claim of universal Brita fit seems legit. Water tastes great. Use the same discretion as for your prescription contacts...change filters before too much time passes for best results.

Just bought another set of these filters, and they don't work very well...they are much easier to pull out of the pitchers, but some of the water never drains into bottom section of the container (and when you tip it to pour, the lid often comes off, pouring water everywhere).

The first 2 filters worked great,but the third worked horribly,the water was bitter and tasted worst if it remained in the pitcher for more than 6 hours.I had to keep throwing the water out and refilling it because it was so bitter.Washing the pitcher itself didn't change the way the water ended up tasting.The option to return it was there but the cost to reship the filter to brita didn't make any sense.

Great value. Continue to reorder for my Brita pitcher. These come in a very small package (I think for wholesalers, maybe?) so I appreciate there is nothing extra to throw away. However, that means there is zero product information included with the filters.

I live overseas in an area with a lot of calcium in the water, so I buy filters each time I'm home in the states to bring back overseas. Each of these six-month filters clogged up and stopped working within two weeks, and one clogged up in under a week! I tried multiple methods of unblocking the filters but no luck. I looked the issue up on the internet and apparently this is not an uncommon issue with these filters. I will stick with the one-month filters from now on as the one-month filters have never had this problem.

Great deal for three replacement filters as compared to purchasing at the store.  These work well and get the fluoride taste out of my tap water, which is particularly bad in my apartment.  So I would recommend these filters for that purpose alone.

I have been using Brita filters for about 20 years now. This year they changed their appearance, but I haven't noticed any differences in the flavor of the water it filters or in the longevity of the filters. The new design makes it easier to remove the filters, and greatly reduces the charcoal particles that used to come out the top of the filters.
Love Brita for 30+ years now use them. I really enjoy getting a valuable set of bulk filters so I don't have to purchase them as often or pay more from stores around me.
The title says it all.  Filters arrived in a timely manner and so far I have had no issues with the one I am currently using.  It fits perfectly and appears to be doing its job.
we filter our water first through a brita water filter attached to the water system....then use this in the water pitcher to filter it again...it makes us happy to know we are drinking great water...
The water doesn't taste as good as regular brita filter. After a month of use it slows down dramatically. Not worth it.

What's to say, they're are actual Brita filters.  The packaging isn't as for commercial resale, but doesn't matter.  I don't know that the price is necessarily lower.  I'd probably just buy them at Target, after these are gone.

Carbon filtering works great. Good for the amount of gallons stated. I live in Jacksonville Fl and this city is listed as in the top ten in the US for the worse quality city water and man can you taste why. Night and day difference after I run it through this filter in my Brita pitcher

Terrible. Tons of black particles every time I pour water into my glass, even though I made sure to rinse the filter before using. The particles continued every time over the course of a month and then the same thing happened when I swapped out the filters.Go buy the Amazon Basics version of these. They cost less, they don't require any sort of pre-use rinse and they actually work the way they are supposed to without black particles!

Brita is arguably the best in the business, but most people don't change their water filter as often (or at all!) as you should. The difference is measurable in taste, odor, and dissolved solids (ppm). Change your filters as per your pitcher's recommendation for the best filtered water money can buy.
its a very bad filters,I have a sensor that from the first day shoved that the filters are not usable,threw them in the trash

Noticed that after one month, I can taste water chemicals and water begins to have an odor.  If I want to enjoy good filtered water, I must change the filter once a month.  It is NOT true that these filters last an average of 2 months. Product needs improvement.  Furthermore, I found out that the water I filtered was so acidic that it made me sick.

the new design is easier to use. no more soaking for 30 minutes before using.  i use a triple military filter first and then the brita just to make sure there isn't a taste to the water.  i compared the price to costco and amazon won.  go figure
after 20 gallons clogged, no recourse .. I wish I could do something like that..sell my old batteries say , take people's money don't answer complaints, just bank it, what a racket

This works very well with my pitcher. And it took much less time to replace this one as you only have to keep it under running water for a couple of seconds as opposed to the older version which had to be soaked in water for some time.The water tastes much better after you use a brita filter. Not sure if its really pure. They are making a great contribution towards a better planet. Kudos to them.

We've been using Brita pitchers and filters for a very long time now - in our home, on our boat, in our camper. Excellent products. Get these and a stainless steel water bottle and never purchase bottled water again.

Judging from the tannin sediment left in the cup after my first cup of tea -- with a brand-new filter, I suspect that this isn't a Brita product, but a fake. Also, I ordered the advanced filters, but got the older ones.

The new design makes it much easier to remove once it's past its prime. It works like the previous model and does a good job of filtering my tap water. Can't beat the price either. It costs about $10 for one in my local stores.
just in 2 weeks it gets clogged tried all 3 of them and they hardy lasted for few weeks - other filters I have used lasted minimum for 8 weeks - these are defective stay away from them waste of money

Our water is good here in Daly City, but your water can never be too pure, right? We use a Brita pitcher for our drinking water and these filters keep the water pure and tasting clean and un-chemical.

We've used Brita for years and years and wouldn't be without it.  We also have a fridge with filtered water dispenser but still use the Brita to filter water for our coffee and for cooking as the filtered water makes a huge difference in taste.

I've used this filter for six weeks and I have to change it because the water takes hours to go through it. It is supposed to last for six months; it's lost its effectiveness in less than two.Not good. I imagine I can't get a refund for $26 because it takes months to find out that it doesn't work.A waste of money.

I currently live in a  very old dorm were the tap water is quite nasty and tastes terrible.I picked up a huge Brita tank with a tap and got these filters for it.These do an amazing job of filtering the water into something drinkable.While these filters do an amazing job at making the taste bearable, they still leave the water tasting a little funny.Only 4 Stars because water taste, but the price here is currently unbeatable.
NA

Yay Brita.  I now am able to drink my 8 glasses of water in a day.Before brita, I could smell the heavy chlorine.After the Brita filters the water, there is no scent.I'm very happy with these filters and Brita.

I'm lucky in that I have good water.  However, the village has increased the amount of chlorine to the point where you can smell and slightly taste right out of the tap. My Brita pitcher and filters get rid of the chlorine, making more enjoying morning coffee and drinking water.

I don't know if it's the fault of the filter or the pitcher, but the brand new filters I have put into the pitcher still register as needing changing even after pushing the reset button. I am just leaving them in for a month or so then putting in a new one. I was unhappy to find the second one did the same thing as the first one, however. Anyone else having a problem???
I have used these before and I noticed that there was clearer and crisp water. I am definitely going to continue buying these filters for my Brita Pitcher

Love these guys.  I'm a big water drinker and definitely know my geography of tap water.  These things take the local taste...whatever makes up that taste...and takes it away.  You water will taste the same everywhere when you used these.  In a good way.

I am on my second filter in a row that has slowed to nothing but a drip of water flow. I resoaked and squeezed the side of the filter to release any possible air bubbles. I read this was suggested from a google search. Very disappointed especially considering the price of these filters. I can not recommend these filters.
Awesome zactly what I was looking for and last a long time they can even last longer what the instructions advise. Now that's what I call high quality H2O.

I ordered this exact filter for my brita water dispenser because the filter that came with it was the one pictured in this advertisement. To my surprise, when I opened it today, they were not the filters pictured above, but the old style filters for the pitcher which filters a lot slower the the advanced filters pictured above. Very Dissappointed!

It helps some, we have really bad city water & using the filter pitcher at least gets it to where it's drinkable. The bottle water is by far better but can't afford to buy it all the time so I was looking for a cost effective way to improve the tap water we have. This does make it better. It is well designed & I'm hoping that the second filter will be better then the first.
This is your typical Brita filter replacement. It fits in my 5 cup space saver pitcher perfectly. It filters water and keeps it fresh. I will be repurchasing!
We haven't used these yet for they are "replacement filters."  As the original filter which comes with the Brita is still working well, we shan't comment on the replacement filters.
After replacing the old one with these it still said it needed to be changed, even after resetting multiple times.. Kinda feel like I was ripped off.

So far so good. No problem found. I have been using this kind of filter for years. I got a good deal when buying 5 packs of this.Update:The manufacture recommends to change the filter every 40 gallons or 2 months. However, I have to change it every 2 weeks (we have 2 people only), otherwise the taste of water is not fresh anymore. I think it depends on water quality in the area where we are living.

I purchased two filters. The first one I opened didn't fit correctly at all. I compared it to a filter that I had bought with my water pitcher and they looked slightly different. I decided to open my other filter and it fit perfectly without having to add any pressure. However, I am disappointed that I paid for two filters and received a defective one. I don't want to 'take a gamble' and hope that my filter fits next time if I do end my purchasing this item again. Quality control really needs to step up their game. Only gave this two stars because one filter actually worked.
I bought these after a year of using an off brand.  Boy I can tell the difference.  It's worth the few extra dollars to pick these puppies up!  Buy these now and you won't regret it.

Perfect fit for your "Brita Everyday Water Filter Pitcher" (of various sizes) and have not found them for a better price in stores that carry them. Amazon is phenomenal at fulfilling orders and partnering with delivery services to ensure great service. At this point I wouldn't think of getting these anywhere else. Plus, Brita's specialty in water purification has impressed me over the years as their originally quality products keep getting better and better!! An easy decision... [add to card now].

Takes over an hour to filter two cups of hour. Very similar to all the other negative reviews. Somebody said it gets air bubbles. Stay away from this product.  Update:  Brita is aware of the problem and is sending 3 regular filters as a replacement.  Still an annoying problem but kudos for the support.

I did not like the filter after a short time. Had to change these pretty often, like once a month. Not sure if it kept everything out as there was no way of really knowing. Decided to buy bottled water again. But it was easy enough to use these in the filter. If I can follow directions for these, anyone can!

Important: if you bought the Advanced Brita Pitcher (with another layer in the lid to redirect the water), you HAVE TO use the Advanced Filter! It is more expensive than the traditional one and I feel the water taste the same.

Bought for my Brita Atlantis pitcher and the company was no help when I explained that it couldn't fit. The box says it fits all pitchers but on the inside it lists newer models. Now that I have to buy a new pitcher I might as well stop using Brita.Waste of time, effort, money do not buy.
Hey! they're cheap; they seem to fill their purpose. I have to say the weird brown box packaging that the filters came in did seem highly suspect though.

There water filters!  They work as advertised but they don't look like the picture.  I've been using these for years, I would think that the price would have dropped a bit buy now but Brita keeps sucking money out of consumers for these filters.I hope that someone like Amazon makes a generic equivalent for cheaper but I haven't seen it yet.

These come in a generic outer box packaging and the inner sealed plastic wrappers are the same you will find as the Brita filters purchased in regular brick and mortar stores. They work very well, just make sure you put them i. The correct way to create a seal in the upper water resevoir

I don't enjoy buying Brita filters any more than I enjoy having to remember to change them. I bought this pack of 5 for less than I'd spend at the grocery store and don't have to deal with filters for a while which to me is a huge bonus. Now if only they were recyclable...
New design sucks. "Filtered" water still tastes like tap water. Can't believe Brita decided to sell this s***. I ended up selling my Brita pitcher.

I've used Brita filters for as long as I could remember. It makes tap water taste delicious, and the key to keeping it that way is to change the filters about every 3 months. I subscribe to this so I don't forget!

HAVENT DONE ANY SCIENTIFIC STUDIES, BUT MY WATER TASTES GREAT! AND, DONT BE FOOLED BY THE MARKETING INSTRUCTIONS, THESE PUPPIES CAN LAST ALMOST A YEAR BEFORE CHANGING THEM! SO LONG AS YOU DONT LEAVE THEM OUT OF THE FRIDGE FOR LONG PERIODS OF TIME FREQUENTLY!

The filter is extremely slow. Maybe it will last longer from not being able to filter as much water per day. Definitively regret the purchase. I'm making a batch of cold brew right now and just filtering the water is taking hours
Water is crystal clear.

These work very well.  We have been using these nearly three months.  After we replaced this filter, there was a very noticeable improvement in the taste of water and ice cubes! I paid full price for these filters and have not been compensated in any way for this review.

I like the new style, it drips the water through the filter faster so we don't have to wait while it slowly goes through in order to add more water. It fits just like the old style, no problem getting it into the pitcher. I also like that you don't have to soak the new filters for 15minutes in water unlike the old style.

these are easier to handle than the older design, they fit my old brita pitcher. the only reason i didn't give 5 stars is that i wish they took out more of the bad stuff. bought mine from amazon llc, they arrived in good condition as described. i don't see carbon particles floating in them, that's better than my last pack i bought in a local store.

I am absolutely loving these new filters...the previous ones had all this black carbon in the reservoir and although it didn't go through to the water, there was still a little concern...4 filters lasts me a year which is so awesome!! A whole lot better and more inexpensive than bottled water and the taste is fantastic...I recommend the pitcher and filters very highly :)
Well I will never purchase non- Brita brand filters again.  USE ONLY BRITA FILTERS FOR BRITA PRODUCTS.  This seller is reputable and has great pricing.  Thank you.

This is our second time using longlast filters, as we thought the first set was broken. Turns out they all seem to be broken. A pitcher of water takes hours to filter through. We soaked it, we squeezed air out, nothing works. Just a flawed design in every conceivable way.
Says up to 120 gallons. We refilled our Brita approx 40 times since we bought this in May. Needs changing already! I get 'up to' is an approximation, but less than half of that? Come on.....

These are great filter refills.  All filters filter slower the longer you use them and they trap more and more, these do seem to become slower faster than the original filters that came in the pitcher, but for the price, I dont mind.

I looked at the bottom of my filter and noticed mold or something building up in the screen of the Brita filter I was using which was a YEAR old.  So it was way over due for a new one.  This was a perfect replacement.  Works great and it filters water faster now so I know I had a bunch of build up in the old filter. Thanks

We've been using Brita Filter Pitchers for years mainly clean up the taste. They do not make water drinkable and should not be used in place of boiling water. These filters remove or reduce some chemical, metals, minerals, etc. But I do like the filtered taste especially after it's been chilled in the refrigerator.
Fit perfectly in my Brita pitcher.  Always a good idea (well water) to filter water.  We use this pitcher to refill our Keurig Coffe Maker.
Excellent water filters from Brita!!!The water taste more pure with this filters and no problems at all...Recommended product!!!

I like it that Brita uses the same filter over many different model pitchers. Ours is an older one, and these work fine! I dated it so we'll replace it before the couple of years of the previous filter...

These used to work but the last 2 orders I received they do not filter water at the same speed. They get clogged and it takes hours for them to filter a couple liters of water. Not to mention, they're always crushed in the package when you get them. That I can live with, but them not working doesn't make sense to buy.

I started buying these online for my Brita water pitcher (LOVE IT).  I found I kept procrastinating going out to Target or Bed Bath and Beyond to buy these and ended up defeating the purpose (my filters were so old they were probably useless).  Enter Amazon Prime, and now I don't have to waste time driving to store--they are delivered within 2 days to my doorstep.  Which means my Brita pitcher actually has CLEAN, FILTERED water because I can change them in a timely fashion.

This was an excellent price per item deal for these Brita water filters, especially since each one lasts for so long. For the price of three in the grocery store, you get five. And the filters themselves are better than ever. No more black flecks floating in the top reservoir ever type you filter more water.
I have a water tester and my water tested with as many or more particles after using the filter.  It does get rid of the chlorine and they put a lot of chlorine in our water (rural water system).

i was just wondering why is it so fast draining the water with the filter in place not like before it will take 2 to 3 minutes tell the buttom of my brita container until it gets full. is there anything wrong with the filter? it seems its not filtering the water?

Brita keeps coming out with better and better filters as time goes on- low carbon dust, longer lasting, purifies well. In addition, they have a neat widget on their website that sends you coupons and discounts!
Works really well in purifying tap water. We have a Brita pitcher and use these all the time. It's really convenient to order them from Amazon. Happy with our purchase!

The item I received was an updated version of the one in the pictures.  The top is a bit different looking.  But per the packaging, you no longer need to soak the filter prior to use (just a quick rinse).  It also claims there is no more black stuff coming out of the top.  I have only used one filter 3-4 times so far, but it seems true.No other noticeable differences.  Filtering fast.
Yes, needed anywhere Calcium is an issue...pair with Apple Cider Vinegar and you never have to worry about calcium rich body stones again.
These new filters work just fine.  They claim they are better than the old ones, so sure, whatever.  They work just fine, I love my Brita!
They work.

We've been using Brita filters for over a decade. They have finally improved the filter by letting you skip the soaking step. Now you just rinse it under cold water for 15 minutes, and you are ready to go. You also don't have to deal with the black flecks. It filters water well and we are happy with the new design.

Easy installation and it filters really well. Texas water absolutely puts it to the test and it hasn't failed me yet. If you're going to buy them, might as well buy them in a pack of 3 or more. They're worth it.
Excellent filters for my Brita water pitcher.  They work just as they should, purifying my tap water.  Great price too, a few bucks cheaper than Target & Walmart.
Need them for my water tank and they do a great job, but they are ridiculously overpriced.
Nothing new except for the same excellent quality Brita water filters.  This new style definitely allows the water to filter down into the carafe (or whatever you are using) faster than the old syle.

About time I replaced our filters! I love Brita products and the ease of use when it comes to replacing the filters. The old filter popped right out and the new one right in. Very simple, great design.
Have been using Brita water filtration system for years; pleased with the Brita.  These filters are Brita filters and fit the pitcher - and at a reasonable price.
These are wonderful, great price for what we got! Last longer the the store bought ones I have. I love brita and these filters are no exception.

Filters great...after it was installed 4x!! For some reason it didn't flow any water out. Then after multiple times and getting the air out of the tubes and leaving a little water in the line it worked.
The Brita water filters filter out bad taste and bad ingredients from tap water. Riverside, California has undrinkable tap water and the Brita water system makes it taste better than bottled water.

I have been using these filters for years, and they seem to work great.  I have noticed that the price fluctuates, depending on how many are in the lot.  When buying these filters, be careful about the price per filter.  Sometimes, you can end up paying more per filter, even if you buy in larger quantities.

Yeah, this is a Brita review, because why? Because these little boxes of charcoal make my disgusting, dirty hot tub smelling municipal chlorine and flouride bath straight from the sewer tap water taste like I'm drinking straight form the freshest mountain stream. These things work wonders!
I use brita filters for years already. They are doing the job and I think are quite affordable.I am happy they do sell it in this bulk package which supply you for half a year.

I have an old Brita pitcher, a design the company does not even make anymore.  These new filters fit it perfectly.Speed - about the same as the old filters.Quality - I feel it's better!Design - beautiful.  It's really a handsome filter, a compliment to Brita's updates to their products.
A very slow filter that does not seem to improve water taste.  Back to the standard three-pack, or repair my reverse osmosis system.

I 'inherited' an old Brita pitcher. This filter fit great. I did have to make sure I popped it in just right. We brought it with us during a 3-day hotel stay to ensure we had filtered water. During the 8-hour drive each way, we filled it up at gas stations and had clean water to drink on the road trip.  I got it to use for weekend trips as I have a water filter attached to my sink. So far it has worked great.

These did not perform nearly as well as the original filtered that came with the pitcher. The water tasted great with the original filter but I can hardly tell the differences with these. The water has that tap taste and I can't taste any different than drinking directly from tap. I noticed from day one that these didn't seem to fit as tight as the original filter, so I'm not even sure if the water is actually being filtered. I own the 10 cup Brita pitcher. I'm very disappointed in these. Will not buy again.

I got the cheapest value pack, and they are built differently. Not a tight fit, so water isnt all forced down through the charcoal filter. I did a taste test with a tighter fit and did taste a difference, but that also might be a difference in quality of filter too.

Once you go filtered, you can never go back.I save easily $50 a month using Brita instead of buying bottle water (even the cheap kind).Unless you have a super expensive water filtration system at your house, every household should have these.  Buying them online with the free shipping puts it at the same price point as your run-of-the-mill Buyers club (IE: BJ's, Costco... exc).
I love my Brita pitcher which means I need Brita filters. They're necessary to have clean tap water in my area. Easy to use. Good price!
These filters are great for the price and came on time, well packaged. They work beautifully and I'll be purchasing them again. :)
Can't beat the price. Been using the same Brita fridge unit for almost 4 years. Keeps the water tasting super fresh, and saves a ton of money compared to buying packs of bottled water every week.
If you want to be impressed by these filters make a tray of ice using these filters.  Cubes are almost clear after water has been filtered.
Love the fact that you don't have to go through the traditional "Brita ritual" of soaking, pre-filtering twice, etc. etc.

Great replacement filters. I'm surprised at how fast water flows through these things, yet the water still tastes so much better than tap. I keep one in my upstairs bathroom to filter my cpap water and for drinking / brushing teeth. Also, way cheaper than most local stores.
They work perfect and there was no damage to the actual product, but the box was very dented and destroyed. I was worried they'd be broken.

I love my Brita pitcher. It is way cheaper than buying bottled water over time. I think they work perfectly. Yes, there is some carbon that floats around for the first initial use, but the instructions tell you that that can happen. It makes our tap water taste great! Amazon has the best prices that I could find.
I like this new filter, but it filters quite a bit slower than the standard Brita pitcher filters. Keep that in mind when considering to buy one. Worth it in the end for me.

Very easy to use and install in my brita water pitcher. I can taste a bit of difference between using it and drinking straight from my sink. Will continue to buy these in the future.The box did come damaged but the filters were in great shape.

Fits my Brita just like the ones in the local store. I was worried because I read reviews on simular products being made in china and not fitting properly. But these filters fit great. No more worries!
We go through filters quickly living in the village in Alaska where the water isn't the best. Have these at an affordable price with really reliable shipping has been great.

So let me start by saying I have a Grand. One of those 10 cup pitchers. This filter fits fine. It does not float when adding water. I have run a few pitcher's worth of water through it now and have not run into the floaty issue. I recommend making sure your pitcher is one of the supported ones listed on the page and packaging. Also, making sure your filter is seated properly helps too. Yes, this filter does take longer to filter X amount of water than one of the "classic" Brita filters. Considering it has a different design/material than the classic filter in order to filter out the additional contaminants listed, I think its a small trade off. Can't handle that trade off? Go for a normal Brita filter. On that note, filtering a full pitcher's worth of water took under 30 minutes. I don't know what other folk are doing, but I would imagine they are either embellishing or doing it wrong.

Great product and price point.  I really needed a filter but did not want to go to Walmart because it was more expensive.  I ended up ordering the filter online and it hasn't failed me. Great same quality that I am used to.  This is a cheaper option than buying bottled water and easy to use and great tasting water.
Great BUY! These filters are a staple in my house as we are trying to drink more from the pitcher versus buying bottled water.

I started to use Brita because buying bottled water at the discounted box store was taking time, money, while it was not as environmentally friendly. I had choices when I purchased Brita at the first time and I'm stuck to it now because its quality is awesome!My water tastes really great and I love this 3 pack deal on Amazon.It's not too many for one person to use for 6 months, and this set doesn't take too much shelf space.

Unlike the last time I tried to buy filters on Amazon, actually received genuine Brita filters. So kudos for that. The filters work great, makes already pure Northwest water taste even better. We stopped buying crates of bottled water and have now switched completely to using the Brita pitcher. Stop being a Paris Hilton, do the earth a favor and please switch to filtered water.
Fits into my pitcher without issue.  Tap water tastes noticeably better - can't comment on the water quality as I have no way to test that.

We use our Brita Water Pitcher daily keeping it full in the refrigerator. After using the last filter it was time to buy more. I usually buy from my local Costco but they were out if stock so I bought these online. Price per unit was comparable to Costco but if I had bought the ten pack when they were back in stock, they are about a buck per unit cheaper at Costco, but if you prefer the 3 pack, these were the best price.

I like the redesign. I see less charcoal Particles with these. But they tend to fall out of place when tipped over too much. It does the job and tastes better than straight tap. Help save the environment and reduce use of plastic bottles.

What can I say?  This filter does what it's supposed to do.The tap water where I live is not tasty, and using these makes me feel better about what I'm putting into my body.The packaging says that it's good for 45 days, although I've gone longer than that without noticing a change in water taste.

The filters work fine. The packaging was smooshed when I received it, but it didn't damage the filters. They last about a month before you need to replace them. I'm not the biggest fan of Brita, but it gets the job done.
I drink so much water it is delicious. I truly drink two 10 cup pitchers a day. Plus it's the healthiest and easiest to do.

I'm pretty sure I'm not going crazy.  I am almost certain that this product used to filter out lead.  But, the box says nothing about reducing lead...only Mercury, copper, cadmium, zinc and chlorine taste & odor.  Won't order again.

THESE FILTERS ARE AWESOME..THEY'RE SUPPOSED TO BE CHANGED MONTHLY, BUT SO FAR IT'S BEEN 2 MONTHS WITH THE SAME ONE...THE TAP WATER WHERE I LIVE IS FILLED WITH IMPURITIES AND CHEMICALS AND TASTES NASTY, BUT WITH THIS FILTER THE WATER IS DELICIOUS, CLEAN AND CRISP. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE FILTERS AS THEY ARE THE BEST ON THE MARKET. I WILL CONTINUE TO ORDER THEM

my office water has gotten really questionable recently with lots of residue, so I drug out my old Britta pitcher that I used to use over ten years ago, and was shocked to discover that the new filters still fit it. They are reasonable priced and do a great job at keeping the water clean

Great price for a three pack of filters. For what I paid for one filter at our local retail store I could get a three pack of filters on Amazon. Happy with the quality and the taste when I use this filter in my Brita filter pitcher. Would definitely recommend.

I moved into a care center a year ago, and had no way to get to the water store to get water. My sister was using a Brita Pitcher so I tried one. I love it. Ordering the replacements filters from Amazon is so wonderful, I cant always get to a store, however I can place an online order and get refills fast. I recommend the Brita products to everyone.
These Work well.  I hope they come out with an even better filter now that they say there are micro-plastics in the water.
We always drink filtered water either from our Brita or refrigerator.  The Brita works well and leaves the water pleasant tasting.
Excellent buy for my pitcher. Improved design. Description says they will fit most of the Brita pitchers, and does fit mine, an earlier version.

Good filters. Great price. My only concern is that on the older version water would take time to go through the filter. Now it goes down quick which makes me question how good is it filtering the water.
These are the older version of the filters that you have to presoak.  Probably been sitting in a warehouse for a couple years.
the package arrived with the box stating that the item was not for resale but for display only but yet it was sold retail
Do NOT buy. Filter floats out of position in Brita and water doesn't get filtered at all. I tried multiple times to push the filter in tightly and it kept floating out. Returning item.
I bought these for Brita model OB24 and I had it in backwards for a month which means I was drinking straight tap-water.

I think these filters may be fake. I have been using these for years. If only one of them did not work, I would not think anything but the same problem with all of them. Filters too fast, and water tastes like crap.

I use my Keurig a lot and was needing to replace those filters a lot more. Since buying and using my Brita pitcher to fill the Keurig it has  definitely saved me money and I feel prolonged the life of my Keurig  greatly as  they remove.-chlorine- copper-magnesium- zincWhich can lead you to need to descaale your brewer more often.

I was very satisfied with my new Brita pitcher. I have been using my brita filter pitcher for few years now, because the water where I live comes through old pipes, can be brown and cloudy, unfortunately. The Brita filter takes care of it, and provides tastier, clearer water
NA
They do exactly what they are supposed to do, which, of course is what we all want from what we buy.  Each cartridge lasts longer than listed by a full 2 weeks, so that saves you some money.

Solid filters.  I had a lot of issues finding these filters at my local CVS and grocery store for some reason, but Amazon came through as always.  The filters must be purged for 15 minutes before use in water (standard).  After using the filter, you will immediately notice that your water tastes fresher and that the previously noticeable water particulates are either significantly reduced or completely gone.  I recommend this product highly.

I like the new handle on the top of the filter. I do not believe there's a proven scientific reason to drink filtered water. But just in case....After a few uses PUR filters take way too long. Does that mean they filter out stuff that is going to make me sick and die an early death? I'll stick to faster Brita for the "just in case" factor.

I have been using Brita for the pass 17 years;when my Aunt introduced me to this product when I had my last son. I have seen the continued  improvements on their water filters and I am happy to say that my preference  has remain the same. Great tasting water that even my last son has stay using and safely  enjoys.
Makes tasty water but they don't fit snug on all britta pitchers. One of them keeps slipping off when dipping the pitcher too much. But then again, its a cheap plastic housing with charcoal in it!!

My water tastes metallic with this filter.  I have used the regular brita filter for years without  this taste. Update:  Several weeks later and I am throwing it away!!  My tap water tastes better without it!!
Is anyone going to read this?? If you need a filter youre going to buy it haha. It filters you water and fits your brita come on haha
I've tried all the knock-offs and I always return to Brita water filters for quality. Six pack was a bargain compared with local prices.

Whenever I want to cook or drink water, I use the item. I can save a lot because I can refill it in every two months and it definitely improves the quality of water, so I dont have to worry about particles in water. I will buy it again!

Brita filters are just okay.  They do improve the water but when the filtered water is warm I can still taste undesirable flavors.  The pack I bought from a seller on Amazon was terrible, however.  The water had a strong charcoal taste no matter how many times I ran water through the filter.  I've read complaints online about this issue with Brita filters so apparently it happens sometimes.
Love Brita, but the original filters came in not the newest advanced I paid for so I returned and purchased elsewhere.

I love this Brita pitcher more and more everyday. This tree pack of filters makes it even more affordable. These filters fit perfectly and will last me almost a years. I change them every three to four months depending on my use. The pitcher recommends changing every two mouths but I find they last a lot longer than that. I figure I will save over $400 a year not having to buy gallons and gallons of purified H2O.

These filters were a bit difficult to install in my Brita pitcher, even though it said they would fit my model.  I had to do a bit of adjustment for the filter to fit.  All in all, they work just fine after the adjustment.

I always keep one extra box of Brita Filters as replacements. Presoaking is not necessary and is no longer required. There are no more leaking carbon flecks due to a new mesh to prevent leaking. Been using Brita Filters for several years and have found them to be the best filters one can purchase.

These filters worked far better than expected.  Even though it does not state that it will remove sulphur odor, it does.  I bought two Brita pitchers at a yard sale and decided to take a chance.  It completely eliminated the rotten-egg sulphur smell right out of the pitcher, not even after it was refrigerated.  Before these, I had to put a pitcher of water in the fridge and leave the cap loose, because the sulphur smell is actually a gas.  After a day or two the water would be somewhat drinkable.  I should've done this years ago.
MMMMM.... because Brita! Brita over tap any day! Also a big plus, these new filters don't let out a bunch of charcoal like the old ones used to.

I love them for their ease of use. this new version is better, no soaking for 15 mins, just a quick rinse under the tap. but you still have to pour out those initials pitchers that have the charcoal in them. someday I hope that step is not necessary.
Exactly as expected branded filters in easy to open packaging.  You can get them cheaper on sale elsewhere though

I love the new filters and that I didn't need to rush out and buy an upgraded pitcher. Very easy to use. I still like to have the first full pitcher of water to use to water my household plants. Glad that the design was kept simple and painless to remove from pitcher when it's time to replace with a fresh one.
Price was reasonable. But it seems with these new filters the water freezes.  Don't know if it is the filters.
What can you say?  Brita is the best water filter.

these are not real Britta filters- I should have know by the cheap price! used for about 2kws and the red light on my Britta pitcher said it was time to change already! I don't think so!  waste of money and my time.

I've observed that it's the tree-hugger types that drink lots and lots and lots of bottled water. Think about this. If there are, by a very conservative SWAG estimate, 5 million Americans (or about 1/50th of our population) drinking four 12-ounce bottles of water a day, that's 7,300,000,000 plastic bottles being added to our landfills every year.That's seven billion, three hundred million. If you laid those 7.3 billion bottles end to end, with no gaps between the bottles, that'd be a *really* long line. (According to the Natural Resources Defense Council, about 1/3rd of Americans drink bottled water "regularly.")My point is, Brita water pitchers and filters have the potential to keep countless billions of plastic bottles out of the waste stream. That's a massive benefit.Now that I'm well into my fifth decade, I drink lots of water each day and I think Brita filters are the best thing since sliced banana nut bread. No kidding. It filters out all kinds of nasty toxins and provides clean, tasty, healthy water - at a FRACTION of the cost of bottled water.Plus, despite the popular criticisms of our municipal water systems, they do provide a good, reliable supply of healthy water. Our generation (baby boomers) may not fully appreciate this, but thanks to water treatment, chlorine and filtration, this country hasn't had a water-borne case of cholera or E. Coli in many decades.Color me skeptical, but I have my doubts about the purity and safety of bottled "spring water" that costs 500 times more than tap water.Pouring your tap water (which can contain heavy metals and other nasties) through a Brita filter is the best of all worlds. Cheap water, clean water and healthy water.If I were queen of the world (and it shouldn't be long now), I'd put the bottled water companies out of business and ask folks to turn wholly to filtration systems (such as Brita) to provide clean, pottable water. And re-use those billions of water bottles for brita-purified water.The only thing that'd make Brita better ---> create a new filter that also filters out flouride. Their current filters do not and I'm not convinced of the safety of flouride.

These seem to be very similar to the previous version of the filters with a couple of improvements, including no more soaking for 15 minutes before use (just rinse and put in), the handy knob on the top for extraction, and maybe it's my imagination but these filters seem to work much faster.

We have a well with a softener system. This filter system does a wonderful job of cleaning the water for cooking and drinking. I would recommend this to anyone with a well! If you live in Flint, MI, you might need something a little more industrial.

No pre soaking these bad boys. Only fifteen seconds under the tap and it's ready to replace an old filter. Works in every Brita Pitcher even my super old one. Filters fast, but maybe that's because the one we've been using was way overdue for replacing.
Had no idea that there are multiple kinds of filters for the BritaWater Pitcher. These did not fit my pitcher. Had to return. No issues from the seller.
Takes away the chlorine taste of water for me. The end result is an easy to drink water. It doesn't give you that feeling of fullness or heaviness that you get with unfiltered water.
This filter is super slow. It takes about half a hour to filter a fill of the pitcher top area and over an hour to fill the pitcher completely (~2.5 fills of the pitcher top area).

Very pleased with the operation of these filters.  Well worth the investment.  The one in our unit was always leaving charcoal deposits in the upper reservoir.  Nothing with the new ones.  Perhaps the old one had been there too long, but we are glad not to see charcoal anymore.

Pretty easy to replace, but it freaks me out that on the packaging it says there may be carbon dust in the first 3 fillings. Worse yet, I doubt the people that use these bother to read the instructions, meaning if I am using a friend's Brita, I may be drinking carbon dust

My water supply is from a well and this makes the water taste perfect or should I say the water is tasteless as it should be.  I've seen other filters advertised on TV, but in my case it would be an over buy.

Love the new design filters so much more, although I still have issues getting the filter to properly seal in it's holder, water always seems to leak around the filter rather then going through the filter.  I have no longer experienced the black specks all over like I did with the old filters.

I wasn't sure about these after reading other reviews so i only ordered two.  I've not had any issues with them popping out, and we fill the jug really full every time.  So far really happy with them and will buy more when we need them.
I LOVE Britta. The filters fit both my pitcher's that are different sizes. They make the water taste pure/clean.

The "drawer pull" top molded onto these new-style filters makes them easy to pull out of the pitcher for changing. They also do not need to be soaked before use, just rinsed. Both improvements are nice, but I think these filters are pricey, even on Amazon (so 4 stars).
