I've been using Brita pitchers for many years, and I love these new filters, they are so much easier to use than the previous versions where you had to keep them in the water them for 5 minutes.Now you just need to put the filter under cold water for 15 seconds, it's perfect!
This was a huge let down. It does not seal all the way and takes insanely long to filter. Just buy the normal Brita filters. This one is terrible

I have well water.  I have never drank it because it just did not taste right.  Weird after-taste for me.  I bought this and now that taste is gone and my water tastes wonderful !!!  No more buying bottled water which saves me a ton of money and saves the planet too !!!

I have used Brita filters for several years now and will never switch. The water tastes great and their somewhat new filter design makes switching the filters much easier (they used to not be contoured at the top making the grip on switching them out somewhat frustrating).

WORKS PERFECTLY WITH MY BRITA PITCHER. I ACCIDENTALLY TURNED ON CAPS LOCK BUT I'M TOO LAZY TO TURN IT OFF, BUT THESE FILTERS ARE GREAT AND WAY CHEAPER HERE THAN BUYING THEM IN STORES, SPECIFICALLY H-E-B.

Please I beg of you do not buy this I want you to Google (Brita reviews )  not only did it get me sick but my family too there is some sort of plastic taste to it and something wrong with this products!!!  Google britta reviews im not the only one !

The filters perform as advertised when - and ONLY when - they do not come loose and float in the pitcher. This has happened on all three of the filters in this pack. When this happens, unfiltered water of courses mixes with filtered water, so the whole system becomes useless.
Filters arrived right on time and were a perfect fit for my brita pitcher. I couldn't be more happy with the product.
These are great... short of a full house or another faucet filter system...  keeping the filter changed in the pitcher is a really nice way to get a cold glass of water.

Not only did these filters not fit in my Brita pitcher, but they made my water stink.  I had been feeling nauseous for days and I couldn't figure out why.  Then the water started to smell and I knew this was the reason.  I have dumped the water and the filter and I feel much better.  DO NOT BUY THESE FILTERS!!!!
Big improvement over the old filters that had to be soaked in water before being placed into the pitcher.
This is another one. I only buy from this company now. I keep in stock in cae of severe weather. Love the Price and the Performance and taste of the water from this filter! FAVE!

The fact that I bought this pitcher (read my other review) is already sad, but these filters, I am glad I did because they sure do not last long. I'm approx 65 days in, on 2nd filter already, of the four total I had for this pitcher. Definitely stay away and buy a fridge w/ water in it.
It smells after 4 weeks! Brita is going down. It used to be good when the old design was available. Now i suspect they put chemicals in the filter to make it go bad earlier. So we can buy more often
I thought was going to replace my water bottles so I bought Brita & this replacement. The first week was working fine after that the filter clogged. Bad experience so I back to my water bottles.

Fits my water pitcher perfectly. I see some reviews complaining about the black carbon dots. You soak it first before using to reduce the number of them.  Yeah you will still have them floating around but none or very few will get past the filter.  I took off one star because I think they could make the design better to never have the black carbons escape the filter.
Great Value purchased as a 3 pack.  Make sure your replacements carry the Brita Logo - as all water filters are not created equal. Very pleased with this purchase.

I was looking for replacement filters for my Brita filter system and each individual filter was high priced and if I did find a duo set I would even have to pay too much even at walmart. I looked in amazon and was pleased to find a two filter set for an affordable price and I didn't even have to leave the house.
Knee surgery, snow outside, I'm not driving to Walmart...These were the same price and I needed other things as well. Fit perfectly into my Brita and I'm a happy camper.

Love my brita pitcher.  We were told that our local water contained so much calcium that it caused most of the kidney stones in our area.  Doctor who removed mine told us this.  We both drink lots of water and with the brita we do not have to worry so much.  I keep it full all the time and use filted water from the frig if not from the pitcher. These were much cheaper than I had purchased in the past.
Brita, I know the charcoal is harmless, but I'd prefer it not to look like someone shook a shaker of pepper over my glasses of water. Makes our chlorine-tasting tap water taste 100% better.
They work great and the new design is an improvement over the older version. The charcoal doesn't come out and there is no need to soak them before using them.
It's a Brita water filter, does what it does. But it feels like slower than the original white filter.
Guess they are ok, Havent had a chance to use them, as my pitcher is quite new..  Its a filter what more can I say

I hadn't bought Britta filters in a long time so the new design was a nice surprise. Much easier to take in and out the container. The new design doesn't leak charcoal like the old ones used to either - what a nice surprise. Much better price than the grocery store!
When I read the reviews I was excited to check this out but this filter didn't work in my dispenser at all. Water flow was very slow. I tried to adjust the position but nothing worked.

Clean tasting water. I noticed that the water quality and taste was a lot better than the tap water I was drinking. That and the fact that I saw some particles swimming around when I was just drinking the tap water made this filter an immediate hit (I'll never know what I was truly drinking lol).Super fast delivery and great deal. Saved a couple of bucks buying a three-pack!
Great filter for such a great price! Very dependable and will continue purchasing for my Brita filter.

When we received the Brita Pitcher, it came with a filter.  That filter worked great!  Our water at home is horrible and after we started using the Brita Pitcher, we no longer have to buy bottled water!  When it was time to change the filter, we bought a 3 count of filters from Amazon.  The first filter worked great but we have since changed and used the last two and with both filters, after one day, our water tasted HORRIBLE!  It had a really strong plastic taste!  We have since thrown all three of these filters away and have started back using bottled water.  Very disappointed!
Nothing exciting, they're water filters.  They work great.I get a two pack delivered every 6 months with Amazon's subscribe and save plan so I don't ever run out.

While the ergonomic design is nice, the performance has dropped considerably.  These "new & improved" filters do not fit as well in my old pitcher and they seem to plug up quickly, extending the time to fill the pitcher.  My original filters seemed to last about twice as long as these do.  I think it's time to switch to another manufacturer.

As expected these Brita filters were offered at a good price and they are just what I needed for my pitcher.  Brita does a great job providing water that tastes great.Just received my second purchase of these excellent filters.  Still a great price for a perfect product.

I bought these to replace old filters.  They work just fine. My only issue that I've had so far is that the filter can sometimes out of its holder and fall into the water holding tank. Other than that they work.
No, this isn't going to last long. I've had this for two weeks now and I can't stand the speed. It takes forever to filter. I'm going to throw the longlast filter out and go back to the regular one.

Great price and these performed as well as the ones you can buy in the store. The product delivered on time, and nothing seemed amiss in quality or performance, which sometimes happens with discounted items.

Not as described.  I ordered these new style filters from Amz but received the old style.  So either they are substituting or the description is wrong.  Judging by the reviews, others are receiving the new style.  I don't know if that is good or bad since I have never had the new style to try.

Great value on this 3 pack of Brita filters. I compared to the local grocery store, who wanted 3 times the amount. Definitely worth it to stock up and buy through Amazon.com. This was my first time trying the new filters, and I was very pleased. I did not have to soak it in water for 15 min, which I had to do with prior model. I also noticed less of the black minerals floating in the water, compared to the older version. Maybe a way to enhance this product is to have the date built in on the filter, so that I will know when to replace it, since I lost the sticker on my actual Brita pitcher.

Using Brita and secondary filter to my refrigerator filter. Water tastes 50 times better. Highly recommend using Brita versus a $2000 alkaline filtration system (just add lemon juice to your water a few times a day) or other high priced water filtration units.
I've been using them for years and I'm a true believer that it filters contaminants in our water...  also check out " structured water" for you health nuts..

I am a regular user of this product and will buy it wherever I can get a good price.  Amazon almost always has the best price for a multi-pack available.  Therefore, Amazon is my first stop when shopping for this product!
Fits, filters and works perfectly. I had an existing pitcher and just needed the replacement filters. This bundle was the best price for the product. very happy with this purchase.
Good product arrived quickly!
I had an older Brita pitcher and this filter fits it perfect.  It's nice Brita didn't change out the size so old and new versions fit.  Thanks Brita!!

I needed more filters for my pitcher. These are okay, but while they say they fit all Brita pitchers, they don't fit mine perfectly and I've noticed that sometimes the water finds its way around the top of the filter and right into the pitcher itself. Plus, a few times when pouring all the way to the bottom, the filter has had a tendency to pop out and rattle around.
The filters make your water from the faucet cleaner and taste better. I will never be without them.
Brita has been the leader in portable water filters for a long time, and with good reason. They make an excellent product. A 3-pack means I don't have to buy them as often, which is good too.

Good price. I didn't think about it until switching out the filters that these are not recyclable...or at least it doesn't mention it on the packaging. That part is a bummer. That's why I bought it to begin with, so I could stop buying plastic bottles.

I have used these filters for some six months now, and while I do not notice any real difference, I do think it is better for your health than drinking water straight out of the tap.  Brita is a well-known brand and the pitcher is durable.
I want to know if these filters remove TCP? And what other chemicals are removed from my water source?

We've used Brita filters for years and have always had plenty of the carbon crystals floating around in the water filling area (pre-filtering).  This is a new design in the filter and fit perfectly in our old unit.  Best part is there are very few loose carbon crystals.  They have redesigned the filter and they did it well.
Great filters, work exactly as described. Fast Shipping, product arrived on time & undamaged, and I overall recommend to anyone who is thinking of buying.
Package arrived damaged but the filters were fine and work just as well as the original filter.

I purchased this with fingers crossed that these replacement filters would actually fit my older pitcher. They do. They also don't seem to have the previous filter design's issue with bits of charcoal collecting at the bottom of the pitcher. Good job on Brita's part with backwards compatibility.

The filters have indeed changed; they process the water more quickly but seem to work as well. If not placed correctly they don't work at all; I made that mistake at first, but it is easily corrected once you realze it is a mistake.

Easy to install/remove, and the box has descriptive instructions if anything is unclear. I usually can notice the filter becoming less effective about 3 months, which is when i get a new one. Definitely worth having a brits filter versus buying bottled water.

These filter were a great buy.  Our well water has a funny taste, so I was purchasing bottled water for drinking.  Then we bought a Brita Pitcher and used it for 3 months before it needed a new filter. With this purchase, we now have a 1 1/2 years of filters. :)

I use Brita filters all the time and would recommend this purchase to anyone. The new and improved filter makes for great tasting filtered water and only has to be rinsed for a few seconds. I give it the thumbs up.
I bought these refills which look a little different than the others I have purchased in the past.  The water flows through them so quickly that I wonder if they really work.
hard to review a filter so i will just say these do the job and do not drop those black particles like they did in the past.
The new fkilters are much easier to use as they do not require pre soaking; ready to use. They fit both of my pitchers and so far are working well with good drainage into pitchers

I'm not sure these do any good what so ever. I notice no different in taste or water quality. When I fill my pitcher, the water just runs right through at a rapid rate. I think I am wasting hard-earned money.

The best water filters for budget price.They are easy to replace and starts working quickly.The water is crystal clear and it workd well.
it probably normal to get some carbon come up into the refill area but it hasn't stopped so not I am concerned.
Have used Brita pitchers & filters for years. Good products. Will continue to use. I even fill my dog & bird's water bowls with Brita Filtered water. The bird is 26-years-old. Just saying...

I love these! I love that I don't spend as much money on water bottles as I was since I can just refill my pitcher. And it cuts down on cost and waste around the house. Would recommend them and their pitcher!
It is an excellent product that exceeded my expectations and was delivered on time. It is an excellent bargain that was well worth the money spent and recommended to anyone interested.

Exactly as described, 3 filters in a package works well for me since I use it less 5 times a week. I recommend seller,  however,  I'm not sure if their the lowest priced. They are the "Best Seller" though.

These occasionally slip out of the filter slot on my older model Brita pitcher when pouring. Also, sometimes the water passes through at a faster rate, which makes me think it's passing around the filter rather than through it.

The newer model of filters are so much better than the old ones.  I actually donated my unused ones of the older style after I tried these.  No more black carbon specs in my water, which can't be good for the body to drink carbon specs.
I've been using Brita products for many years and have always been happy with them. Buying the replacement filters in multi-packs is a great cost savings. Great product!
An Ideal choice for all BRITA pitchers!Easy, hassle free replacement filters.Each last well over 2 months.BRITA water taste delicious!
Works as advertised.  I also find that these filters don't have as many issues with the beads coming out or leaking of carbon (though I still prewash and dump flowthrough).

Love these filters! So easy to prep and install. Once I started using my Brita pitcher I've yet to drink straight tap water. Completely takes out that funky tap water taste and makes it taste better than bottled water. Thankfully these come in packs so I can't stock up on them.
The filters are great, but I just picked up a 10 pack from my local Costco for $21.  The price is why I'm giving this 3 stars.
I use Brita to filter my refridgerators filter which that gets changed every 6 months. I'll try Zero Water the next time I buy a new pitcher.
I like to change my water filters often and the good price of this product helps my budget.

better than the older Brita filters.  The older model filters would leave charcoal sediment at in your pitcher.  I always hated that.  These newer models seem to have fixed that problem.  Highly recommended if you are still using Brita.

I have the Brita Everyday Water Filter Pitcher (10 cups) and these filters are the perfect fit. The instructions are simple and easy to follow. The water tastes great even though it is just filtered tap water.
Much better than the old version.  Water filters through faster and doesn't have the black bits anymore (at least right now).
These are great filters. They don't shed black small coal particles during the use like the older version of Brita filters used to do. I guess they came up with a better model..
the way it is installed into the tank may allow some water to go through without filtration,  may leave some blast residue on bottom of upper tank

The genuine article here. I switched from a DuPont that I could no longer find filters for to a Brita. Easy enough to find these anywhere but Amazon prices are the lowest. They last a couple months of moderate use but the new design cuts down on the amount of charcoal draining into the pitcher.

Those water filters are without the black "sudzy" color residue and granules. Hurra! Finally they are done with different formula of filtration system. Clean, clear, easy to remove used one since it does have smal button like holder on top of it as pictured. I will be buying those!
Fair price, good filtration.

I didn't do an extensive test on the purity of the water filtered by this Brita filter, but the taste is better than the tap water!  Also, it didn't need to be soaked for 5 minutes or anything - just open and use.  I do hope it lasts as long as advertised!  Only one way to find out....
I didn't notice at first, but I keep finding some black powder in my water because of this filter. It used to be fine though. So disappointed.

Two of mine are leaking activated charcoal (or whatever the filter contains) in significant quantities, like, black snowflakes. Considering how the activated charcoal is what's capturing all of the nasty things I'd rather not drink, this is a (total?) failure of the filter.
Hi - Needed refill filters for my pitcher.  Will order again.Thank you.Marsha
These new water filters by Brita are truly an improvement.  No more charcoal floating around in top water bin and they seem to filter more quickly than the old ones used to.

These are a must have as they are extremely effective and Amazon has the best price by far.  The water here in SLC it terrible tasting and using these in the Brita Pitcher keeps a great tasting glass of water or the best cup of coffee at a moments notice.  While I am not a 'tree hugger' this is far more environmentally friendly AND cost effective, and better tasting than bottled water.

This is hands down best upgrade that Brita has made on their filters. As advertised, no more black specks and particles floating around and it does seem like water is flowing down faster. Not sure what they did but I am well pleased with these new filters.
If you have a Brita pitcher, than these will work as intended. The new design is easy to use and fits just fine.
This is a great value.  Especially when you go to the store to buy these they cost much more.  This is a great price for quantity of filters you receive.

Bought these to use in a Brita Pitcher that must be close to 10 years old.  Fit was perfect, water flows through nicely but the best thing about these new style filters is that there is no more small black flecks of charcoal that seem to have always floated out of the original style filters.
These don't quite fit my Brita pitcher but I finally got it seated well enough to work. Definitely would not buy them again.

They fit perfectly into my Brita pitcher! I've been searching forever for these, and I'm so glad I could find them online! I also like that they come in packs of 3 - You really don't need to stock up on any more than that at a time.

Just want I needed and they fit perfectly For low cost. YAY...  can't ask for more.

Fit the Brita pitcher & work exactly as expected. I had tried a "no frills" brand and they stopped working after a very short time. I will stick with these Brita replacement filters from now on.
These fit all Brita water pitchers. I had one that leaked a little, but most have done great. They fit, and the water tastes great after going through the filter. Recommended product.

These are just what I expected.  I don't personally find them difficult to install at all.  They work great.  No weird residue.  Will buy again.

arrived on time this is a great product, price for 3 very competitive will buy again have been using Brita for over five years

What's not to love about a reasonably priced water filter replacement pack?  I have the 10 cup everyday Brita water pitcher that I received as a gift and when the original filter needed to be replaced, I set out looking for replacements at stores.  I almost gave up on the pitcher completely because I didn't want to pay the amount they were charging for replacements.  Then I checked out Amazon and was happy to find that they didn't charge you up the wall for these.  Amazon is the best place I've found to buy replacement filters.As far as quality goes, Brita is top of the line.  The water tastes crisp and fresh, which is a major plus because the tap water normally tastes like metal in the city I live in.  The filters generally only last for about 3 months, but think about how much water you go through in 3 months?  The cost of 1 brita filter vs. the amount of bottled water you could buy in that time period can't even compare.

The Brita filters consistently produce drinking water that is better tasting than bottled water at a fraction of the cost and without the use of all the plastic bottles.Regardless of the Brita container used the flow rate through the filter is about the same.  Drinking water, coffee, bourbon and water, and anything with ice tastes better.One of the concerns with the inline filters is that they remove chlorine or other disinfectants from the water on the faucet side of the filter. If not used frequently there is a potential problem for both contamination and picking up the taste from metallic piping systems. Brita cautions that once water is filtered it should be stored in the refrigerator.If you like pure water at an economical price and care enough not to create more plastic bottles this is the system for you.Brita listened to those who thought the original containers were way too large and cumbersome. The new pitchers are great.For the kids cool water from the refrigerator is much better than soft drinks and again a fraction of the cost.I have three of the pitchers (office, home and cabin)  and disposed of my old large container.Highly recommended.

after soaking one in water, as described prior to replacing the old filter, run some water thru the filter under the spigot to clear out some carbon.  otherwise your 1st run thru the pitcher has this" remainder carbon"  and the 1st batch of water  has to be "pitched"

We have used Brita filter pitchers for years, but I guess we have to find a new filter pitcher. The Brita cartridges no longer work adequately. For the last year or two we have seen carbon particles in the bottom of the pitcher and in our glass. The amount of carbon leakage has varied from cartridge to cartridge, but seems to get worse each time we buy a new package of them. The latest package is also deficient in filtering the strong chlorine taste from the tap water. It's very disappointing to see a formerly excellent product deteriorate so dramatically that it has become virtually useless for it's purpose. If the post I read indicating that Brita was acquired by Clorox is correct, I guess this is yet another example of companies with high quality being acquired by larger companies that want to maximize profits by cutting costs. The quality goes away and life becomes a bit less pleasant with each example of this trend.

As a cruise ship employee, I don't have luxury of home appliances and access to many things other people take for granted. One of them is a source of clean, fresh water.yeah, ships do have a water treatment plant but all the water onboard is HEAVILY chlorinated and if you drink it out of the tap, trust me, you won't feel so good. So, for years i was buying bottled water until I saw one of shipboard officers using Brita water pitcher with filter. Long story short, I got one too.Boy, what a change!For once I don't have to shell out a bunch of money for bottled water. Second, instead of running up and down and waiting for ship's store to open, I have fresh water right in my own room! And finally, it takes LESS space than a set of dozen bottles!I was worried about black particles that people talk about but so far, I had no problems with that. Several of them is floating in upper tank but filtered water is blissfully free of any impurities.I have to say that I'm extremely happy with this purchase and I will buy more filters and additional pitchers for my home too, especially since me and my lady are expecting a second child now and you can never be too cautious about water quality!Thanks Brita!

I have both a PUR filter on my faucet and 2 Brita Pitchers. My wife and I both agree the Brita is the better of the two. Not sure why, the PUR seems to be designed with a more in depth filter, but the Brita water has a distinctive neutral taste that you expect from water. I have a good source from a deep well, but Iron Bacteria is a problem, and the Brita does a great job of filtering any odd taste out. Highly recommended. Ignore the bits of charcoal that float up, they never get through, and it seems it is just a part of the fine charcoal filter package. They do last the advertised time, and it seems a lot better way to do it, than to have mega piles of empty plastic bottles, and you don't have to worry about plastic chemical leaching into the water you're drinking. Cost effective solution.

I am wondering whether the shipping is not handled properly and the filters are pressed out of shape a little.4/11/2013 Follow upMy husband played with the filters and accidentally found that you have to push very hard in order to seal the filter.I used to just push it a little bit and it worked for most filters. I am fortunate to live in a city known for its good water, but that water can arrive at the tap after lengthy travels through lead piping. Further, if it rains heavily where your city's water storage is, your water can be clouded.Enter the Brita Water Filter Pitcher, in all its phases. This filter removes cloudiness, as well as that awful metallic taste, and leaves water as fresh and, well, water-flavored as you might wish. There's nothing now in it to interfere with realizing the full flavor of coffee or tea, or reduce the deliciousness of a tall chilled glass of it right after exercise.If you boil your water for a reason OTHER than killing micro-organisms, consider this: by doing so you are concentrating metallic particles. If you do boil your water, filter it after.I've seen an Instructable for "refilling" these: sorry, but that doesn't work. It uses only activated charcoal, which will not remove the metallic bits & pieces you want to avoid (you really do).Want to feel good? Cough up for a pitcher and filter. Replace it as often as you need to. It's a great investment in your health.
Really love these new filters, no carbon residue/thingies on the top of my Brita anymore.

Ok, the filters are pretty good and cost effective so it's worth some trouble to use them.  And Brita is plenty of trouble.  They have poor management and poor quality control, so here's the trouble you will have to contend with:  1.  the directions for replacing filters are wrong -- you do not drop them into the hole, they only fit at one angle so you must gently rotate them until you find the right fit, then slide down into the hole (but don't forget that they don't actually screw in or when u go to replace a filter u will try to turn it to remove it and it won't turn once seated -- better to tap from bottom to loosen);  2.  the lid to the pitcher (into which this fits) is poorly made and does not fit so it will keep falling off unless you hold it;  once the lid falls off, the filter can pop out and fall into the sink if you are emptying the pitcher all the way.  In short, the Brita system seems to work well enough for a reasonable price, but the company has general distain for customers so they don't fix well known, long standing problems.  If u can live with the problems, the system will probably work for you.  BTW, filters come in 3, 4, 6, 10 packs.  Oddly, cost per unit is best in the 3 pack (as of now).

Well only $7 on amazon for what would be $10 to $13 in a drugstore or Kmart in NYC. Although next time I'm getting the four-pack, then they're only $5 each.A note, I have used Pur filters in the past, which yield slightly better tasting water if you are very picky. But Pur takes longer to pass through the filter, costs a bit more, and reviews of the latest models mention several problems, implying that they stop filtering water altogether after a certain period, and might be designed for planned obsolescence so you have to buy replacements more frequently. Someone cut open a filter that had stopped working and noticed white pellets had expanded to block water flow.If this is the case it's a low move on Pur's part, bec different houses and regions will have different levels of impurities, so a filter that might last just 40 gallons in one house might last 80 gallons in a house with a cleaner water supply, so to make the filters stop working after exactly 40 gallons isn't cool. Until Pur fixes this, I'm sticking with Brita.

They work. Not sure how much more detailed I can get about these. I'm getting ready to order more. We use them in the office fridge for people who can't stand to drink municiple water from the tap. Our Brita Max has an indicator on it that tells you when it's time to change the filter. But I don't need their stinking gauge. I can tell by drinking the stinking water. The filters really do work. I'm not sure what all they remove, technically speaking, but I do know they make the water taste better. Then, I took the pH tester from my kid's aquarium kit and tested both the tap water and the water from the Brita Max. The tap water tested very alkaline, and the Brita water tested 7.0 - which is what pure water should test at.I'm convinced. Now.

PROS: Works as advertised, makes Baltimore water taste way better.CONS: Every time I open the reservoir, I see what looks like pepper.FINAL VERDICT: Don't have much of a choice when it comes to what filter you want to put in your Brita.SUMMARY: As mentioned above in Cons, the filter appears to be causing backwash. Note, this is not going into what I drink, the other way around. When I fill it up with water, there is a top half (reservoir) that slowly allows water to flow through the filter and down into the bottom half. It's the reservoir that is filling up inexplicably with this stuff. I rinse it out and it keeps coming. But as long as it doesn't get into my drink, I suppose I can't complain. Just not too appetizing.

I have a number of Brita filter systems and have been using the products for about 30 years. And finally they improved the filter!The new designed filter eliminates the pre-soak. Used to fill a large cup with water, set the filter in it and walk away for a time. Would even tap on the cup to work the air out of the old filters. This new one, rinse it off and drop it in.The water also passes through faster. I see here a lot of concern about this and people seem to think the filter is either defective or not placed in the pitcher correctly. Well with the dispensers I have, the filter will only fit in one way as there is a notch on them that a tab on the dispenser that fits into it. And they all seemed to be seating in fine. I have even gone so far as to watch closely and see that the water is pouring out the holes in the bottom of the filter and NOT going around it. I think it is just part of the improved design. They also seem to weigh less than old design so that may have something to do with it. Other water filters work without slowing the water down, why can't these.

There's Brita and Pur.  Brita came before Pur and everyone loved it.  Now, the findings if you search will yield that Pur is only slightly ahead of Brita for filtering.  Only Slighty.  I drink Zepherhills bottled water.  And I love my coffee.  We have city water.  So I did some REAL taste test with my morning coffee.  The Brita made a far more smoother cup of coffee.  A marked difference over Pur.  I will never go back to Pur for my coffee making.  Brita has much more charcoal for taste/odor filtering.  So you see it in the first pitcher with a new filter.  Yes, I have to discard the first pitcher of water after inserting a new filter.  Big Deal, it is worth the taste.  Note that the filter brands will generally interchange between brands of pitchers.  Brita all the way, and don't look back.

I hardly ever leave a bad review, and truth be told it was my fault for not paying more attention to the brand of filters I purchased. When I ordered these I received my box of filters and popped one into the Brita pitcher and it worked great. The next one I put in seemed to run slow. I left water in the top reservoir and came back to it a half hour later to find barely any of the water had run through. I figured ok, a bad filter. It happens. I put another filter from the box in (Yes, I followed the instruction and soaked both filters as described on the package and as I have done every time I put a new filter in) and same story. A little bit of the water ran through after an agonizingly long period of time but it eventually completely stopped. My wife said it was because these were generic filters and not Brita brand products. Needless to say this is the last time I purchase these filters. I'm gonna stick with the name brand.

These are the water filters for the Brita pitcher. I ordered the three pack because the price per filter was reduced, as compared to the single filter purchase. There are also larger quantity packages with even more savings. I have used only one filter so far, and it worked even better that the filter that came with the pitcher. What I mean is that you must rinse the filter before inserting it in the pitcher. Once inserted, you may see some small particles of charcoal on the pitcher bottom. While it is not a health issue, Brita recommends dumping the water and filtering a new batch, until the water is clear. When I rinsed this replacement filter, and inserted it, I did not get any charcoal dust at all. Maybe it was luck, but that is the way it turned out. If you are going to use a Brite appliance, use the proper filter. But, read the package sizes when you do, to get the price that pleases you the most.

My husband primarily uses the Brita pitcher at work instead of drinking out of the drinking fountains or tap water from the sink.  We recently went on a road trip and decided to take it with us.  It was a little slow to filter the water, but the water always tasted great and it saved us from having to buy and carry a supply of plastic water bottles or constantly be filling up our water bottles at the rest stop fountains.  We even used it to filter the water at the place we stayed.  There is one caveat to these filters though, we had to constantly keep water in it so that it would not dry out.  That wasn't really a problem though as we were constantly using it.  Great, refreshing taste at a fraction of the cost it would have cost us for bottled water!

I've been using Brita filters for just a few months in the apartment--my last filter I got mid-June and it lasted me until mid-September just fine. I think my friend noticed that the taste of the water had changed by then (since it was due for a change in August) but it still seemed fine for me. I replaced the filter today and everything works great again.Pros: each of the filters were individually packagedThere were clear and detailed directions on each individual package (useful because I forgot how many rinses etc. it needed)Easy to install in just a couple of minutes--no twisting or using lots of strength. when sliding the filters back in make sure to line up the grooves on the bottom.it doesn't take too long to rinse out and start drinking water from it, and the taste of the water is noticeably improvedCons: I'm a little sad that these have to be changed every 2-3 months, but at least it makes getting the 3-pack worth it!

I've been using conventional Brita filters for my Brita pitcher at work for several years. I teach at a college, so typically I'll change the filter at the beginning of every semester. The Brita Longlast is supposed to give me 300% more filtering time, which would mean only changing once every 1.5 years at work. This sounds almost too good to be true, but we shall see. So far so good. Another advantage, is that this filter has a more robust filtering system. It's purported to reduce more contaminants, including 99% of lead. For home use, this filter is supposed to be changed every 120 gallons, which for a family is about 6 months. So far it seems worth the extra investment for a "heavy duty" filter. Recommended.

I ordered the pitcher and these replacement filters to go with 6 months ago. The canister came with a filter so I put the other filters away. They have been  sitting in the closet for the last 6 months Well, today I opened the box and the first filterwas defective but I needed one so  I opened another one and come to find out after the third one that all three were bent so they can't fit into the space provided for them and they had charcoal carbon all inside of the individual packages because it had spilled out due to the bend and not being sealed. I can't use any of them and we are out of filters. The box  was a little crushed when I received it, but not enough that I would think anything had happened to the filters. I wrote a letter to Amazon telling them I am not looking for money back, just  for good filters. They said  "I apologize for the issues with your order and promise that we strive to do everything in our power to make our customers happy. Unfortunately, we support a 30 day return policy and, as of today, your order was placed (180) days ago. While we are unable to accept your return, I suggest contacting the manufacturer of the product to see if the product is under warranty and if you can receive a replacement. Again, I apologize and I wish that there was more I could do for you in this situation. Please let me know if you need anything else and have a wonderful day." Thanks a lot for standing by your defective product Amazon!!! BTW, I contacted the manufacturer and they are replacing it no questions asked. You should take a customer service lesson from them.
